loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
A sus 55 años de edad Ana es una mujer luchadora que nunca se ha dejado vencer por las dificultades, por el contrario se ha dedicado a trabajar para sacar a su familia adelante, hoy en día divide su tiempo en 2 labores, en la semana cuida niños de su comunidad y los fines de semana vende comida en la ciclovía de Bello, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia.

Con la ilusión de seguir progresando, Ana quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar los alimentos pero no cuenta con el capital para dichas compras por lo que solicita un préstamo que le permita surtir el negocio, mejorar las ventas y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 55, Ana is a fighter who has never given up in face of difficulties. On the contrary, she has invested herself in her work to move her family forward. She divides her time between 2 businesses. During the week she takes care of children in her community and on the weekends she sells foods in Ciclovia de Bello, a municipality in the department of Antioquia.

With the dream of continual progress, Ana wants to purchase ingredients she needs to prepare foods. But she doesn't have the capital funds for these purchases. For this reason she requests a loan. It will permit her to supply her business, to improve her sales, and consequently, to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the market to her place of business. She dreams of opening a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase eight bags of wheat flour and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of the loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase eight bags of wheat flour and beans for resale.

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godafreda is 59 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her husband works as a seaweed farmer.

Godafreda has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for nine years. She sells soft drinks, shampoo, coffee and other items. Godafreda also sells coconut wine to the people in her community. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, soft drinks, shampoo and soap. 

Godafreda hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as coconut wine, soft drinks, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is 30 years old. He is married and has one child who is 8 years old.  He sells tablecloths and fabric to earn a living.  He has been in this business for five years. He has managed to provide for his family including educating his child with the income from his business. Philip also has a motorbike transport (bodaboda) business to supplement his family's income. Philip has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy tablecloths.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths.

loans.name: La Villita De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Marisol cuenta 32 años de edad, es casada  tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentra estudiando Roberto e Iván están estudiando la secundaria, José Gabriel está cursando la primaria, su esposo se llama Roberto él trabaja de albañil.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende tamales y elotes, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar los tamales y los elotes, ella tiene poco tiempo que está trabajando su negocio pero ella dice que le gusta su trabajo y espera sacar adelante ya que de su trabajo ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela, doña Marisol espera que su incremente un poco ya que quiere comprar un carrito para vender y estar mas cómoda ya que ahora lo esta haciendo en una carretilla.

Marisol pertenece al grapo la villita de san marcos el cual está integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres todas están realizando una actividad comercial a continuación serán mencionadas:

Martiana, Tomasa, María Elena, Cira, Eneima, Isabel, Elsa, Reyna, y María Eva, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: productos de abarrotes, comida, pescados, refrescos, agua de garrafón, pan, tamales, etc.
texts.en:
Marisol is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  Roberto and Iván are in high school and José Gabriel is in elementary school.  Marisol's husband is called Roberto and he works as a builder.

Marisol works selling tamales and grilled corn.  She will invest her loan in buying the supplies that she uses to make her tamales and corn.  She has not been working in her business for long but she says that she enjoys her work and hopes to make progress because, through her work, she helps her children with their school expenses.  Marisol hopes to increase her business a little as she would like to buy a van from which to make her sales.  She will be more comfortable because right now she is making her sales from a hand cart.

Marisol belongs to the 'La Villita de San Marcos' group which has 10 members.  They are all women and they are all engaged in their own business activities.  The members are Martiana, Tomasa, María Elena, Cira, Eneima, Isabel, Elsa, Reyna and María Eva.  Their businesses include selling groceries, food, fish, soft drinks, demijohns of water, bread, tamales, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, mayonnaise, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Jose Efrain  es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, estudio la educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este negocio como operador, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien de dedica al mismo oficio de tejeduría.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima consistente en hilos de diferentes clases y colores. Espera en el futuro contar con colaboradores.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Efrain, 30, is married and has a primary education.  His two children are not in school yet.  He is a weaver and began the business as an operator.  He has four years of experience and counts on his wife for support since she also weaves.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials consisting of different colored and types of yarn.  He hopes to have more workers in the future.

loans.use: To buy yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Sop Mame Rokhaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 28 mars 2008. IL est composé de 11 membres issus du même Quartier.

Coumba (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupement, elle est veuve est âgée de 41 ans et à en charge  05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en légumes. 

Son objectif est d'élargir son commerce et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Rokhaya group was created on the 28th of March, 2008. It is made up of 11 members who all live in the same area.

Coumba, standing on the right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 41 years old, widowed and is raising 5 children. She is an experienced saleswoman who has been selling vegetables for several years. She will use the loan to restock on vegetables so that she can better satisfy her customer demand.

Coumba would like to expand her business and increase her profits, so that she is able to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 37-year-old woman who is married and a mother of two beautiful children. Her husband has a transport business and supports the family financially. Milka is a hairdresser who operates a salon and cosmetic shop. She has been in this business for three years, with a monthly income of 27,500 KS.

This will be Milka‘s third loan with KADET LTD. She has repaid all other loans successfully. With this loan she wants to buy beauty products for another cosmetic shop she is opening in a different town so that she can maximize on the profits. In the future she wants to be a successful businesswoman in Limuru.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for another cosmetic shop she is opening

loans.name: Yasmina Calletana

texts.es:
La actividad de docencia es de mucha importancia porque por medio de esta, se forjan los grandes profesionales del mañana, además que es un canal para el desarrollo de una nación. En el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, la señora Yasmina Calletana se desempeña como docente de educación primaria donde tiene muchos años de laborar.

Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para invertirlos exclusivamente en la mejora de su vivienda principalmente para la compra de cemento, arena, zinc y ladrillos con el objetivo de construir un cuarto para seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y tener un techo digno donde habitar en conjunto con dicha familia.
texts.en:
Teaching is a very important profession because it shapes the adult professionals of tomorrow and is a way to develop a nation.  Yasmina Calletana has worked for many years as a primary school teacher in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón.

Yasmina is currently asking for a loan so she can invest in improving her home.  She is going to purchase cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing, and bricks in order to build a room.  This will help her to continue improving her family’s living conditions and have a decent home where the family can live together.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing, and bricks.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town. She has an eleventh-grade education. She is married; her husband works with Liberia National Election. They have four children between 10 and 24 years old; all of them are in school and live at home. Mamie has been selling palm oil and plantains for the past 20 years. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Chut is 53 years old. She has three children whom are all adult. She raises doves and sells sausage in the market for a living. She has done these job for 13 years and gained from them 4,300,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to upgrade and enlarge her dove cages.

loans.use: to upgrade and enlarge her dove cages.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: A 43 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée et mère de deux  enfants. Yawa vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Yawa vend du sel en parcourant son quartier afin de gagner sa vie. Yawa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de sel afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a 43-year-old married mother to two children. She lives in the district of Agoe. In order to meet her children's needs, Yawa sells salt as a street vendor in her local area to earn a living. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market. Yawa needs this loan to purchase bags of salt so she can earn greater profits. By doing this, she will be able to help her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of salt

loans.name: Iris Yovanis

texts.en:
My name is Iris S. and I sell hats, shirts, T-shirts for men as well as skirts, slips, cosmetics and children's clothes. I have had my business for 9 years and I have many loyal customers who enjoy my fair prices and good quality of my products. My business helps to generate an income that covers family expenses and the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase shirts, T-shirts, hats, skirts, slips, clotheshooks, pocketbooks and bags.

Mi nombre es Iris S., me dedico a la venta de gorras, camisas y camisetas para hombres, fajas, faldas, cosmeticos y ropa de niño. tengo mi negocio desde hace 9 años, y es visitado por clientes fijos que tengo, ya que brindo buenos precios y calidad en el producto, mi negocio me genera ganancias para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y el estudio de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, camisetas, gorras, faldas, fajas, ganchos de ropa, bolsas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria R., 26, married and started her business just after her last year in school; that was the only way she earned money for her young family. She joined the microcredit programme of SPBD in 2005 after facing a lot of difficulties with her small business.  After her first loan with SPBD she started to recover and her retail store is now expanding and providing  steady income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (soft drinks, food stuffs) for her retail shop

loans.name: Amine

texts.en: Amine M. lives in the small village of Shahnerzerli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan where she is beginning to raise cattle. Amine is looking for funding so that she can purchase more cattle in order to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mrs. Kuch N. is 58 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband and their 1 child.  She operates a small restaurant that sells fried fish, rice, and pickles.  She earns about $4/day in this business, while her husband earns $2/day working construction.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Kuch N. to buy some cooking supplies and utensils for her restaurant.  She will also use a small part of the loan to buy her husband tools so that he can earn more income per day.  In the future, she hopes to make a more proper restaurant with a full menu in order to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for her restaurant, and tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Ten years ago Aslan started his own business. He is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Aslan and his family live in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. This man needs a loan of $475 to purchase pesticides for his orchard.

loans.use: To buy  pesticides for his orchard

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a married mother of seven children. She is 44 years old and lives in Benin.

To improve her family's quality of life, 18 years ago Eunice E. decided to start her own business of selling food and clothes and baking cakes, meat pies and other catering activities. She sells and supplies to schools and her neighbors.

Her quality of service has increased the number of her customers. In order to meet the demand from her customers, she needs a $325 loan to purchase catering material and foodstuffs. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and catering material

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Mrs. Chey K., 35, is married and lives with her husband and two little kids in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  To support the household, she and her husband work raising poultry and also work as brokers buying yams from growers and selling them for a profit.  This activity enables them to generate collectively about $2/day of profit.  This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more yams and to invest in their business.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and invest in their business.

loans.name: Faiyzinisso

texts.ru:
Faiyzinisso B. is 41 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 4 children. Faiyzinisso has been purchasing and reselling livestock for 2 years. She plans to use the loan to purchase young calves to feed and resell.

Faiyzinisso will resell the animals every 40-45 days. She will use the profits to purchase new calves and their feed and will use the leftover money to support her family. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонова Файзиниссо, возраст 41 год, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Файзиниссо занимается куплей продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота уже в течение 2 лет. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Она будет продавать скот через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученые деньги она будет приобретать молодых бычков и корм для них, а на оставшуюся часть денежных средств приобретать необходимый товары и продукты для своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of livestock

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru:
Kumri H. is 38 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 3 children. Kumri sells clothing and has been in this business for 7 years. She will use her loan to purchase new products for sale. The loan will help local residents to purchase warm winter and children’s clothing at the local markets without having to spend extra money on transportation to travel to other markets.

Kumri will pay back the loan during a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холикова Кумри, возраст – 38 лет, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Кумри занимается торговлей вещами. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент продаваемого товара. Даныый кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые им женские, детские теплые вещи, на рынке у себя на местном рынке, не выезжая при за его пределы и не неся дополнительные расходы связанные с транспортом. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase new products for sale

loans.name: Kabumbi V D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Florence is 21 years old and is single. Each week, Namuyimba makes approximately UGX 55000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in a sweater knitting business. Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy a sewing machine and the loan was paid back on time.

Namuyimba is joined in her small group by Ritah K., Ruth N., Farida N., and Susan N.. Ritah K. has a salon and cosmetic shop business and wants to purchase a hair dryer. Ruth N. is currently operating a business selling paraffin and wants a loan to add more working capital. Farida N. operates a cosmetic sales business and wants to increase stock. Susan N. is currently in the business of fresh food sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost tailoring business

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em S., 34, is a mother of four children who lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To sustain the family’s income, she owns a plot of farmland growing rice. Normally she earns less than $1 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. San Chomreun, age 38, is a chief construction worker building houses, making about $7 a day.  One of their children works at the construction site at a salary of $50 a month. Mr San Chomreun  has applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to assist with his construction work.

loans.use: To purchase wood to assist with his construction work.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat N., 31, works making Khmer wine (made from steamy rice) and sells it for a profit. With her business activity, she can make about $2 per day of income. Her husband works driving a motor-taxi to transport passengers from place to place, earning about $5 per day of income.

She has three little children who are too young to attend school. Her husband finds recently that if he can have a trailer to attach to his motor-bike, he will be able to not only transport passenger but to also transport goods for the market vendors from place to place, which can generate further income for his household. Mrs.Khat N. and her husband would like to take out this loan to purchase a trailer to use to expand their business. ( Her husband is pictured with his motor-bike because Mrs. Khat N. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to expand a business.

loans.name: Sissode

texts.fr:
Born in August 1958 in Ketou, Benin, Mrs. Sissode A. is a housewife and widow raising three children, aged 14, 12, and 10. She lives in the neighborhood called PK10 in the commune of Seme Podji. She cooks and sells cornmeal mush. To increase her earnings, she also sells corn which some women prefer to buy on credit, in view of their meager financial means. Since it is presently the season where the price of corn begins to rise, Mrs. A. is asking for this loan so that she can stock up on corn and avoid the rise in prices.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en Août 1958 à KETOU au BENIN, dame A. Sissode est ménagère et veuve ayant sous sa charge 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 14, 12, et 10 ans. Elle habite le quartier PK10, un quartier de la commune de SEME PODJI. Elle prépare de la pâte de maïs bouillie qu’elle vend. Pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire, elle vend également le maïs dont d’autres femmes préfèrent l’achat à crédit, compte tenu de leur faible capacité financière. En raison de la saison actuelle où le prix du maïs commence par augmenter, dame A. Sissode sollicite ce crédit afin de vite s’approvisionner pour contourner la hausse du prix du maïs.

loans.use:
purchase of 9 bags of 50 kilograms of corn

Achat de 9 sacs de 50 kilogrammes de maïs.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 33, is married and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells fish at the local food market earning US$2.50, while her husband feeds poultry for US$1 per day. Two of their children attend the local school, while the other is too young to attend school or work. High inflation has resulted in rising costs in Cambodia and many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income.

Lun S. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motortaxi service near the market. The market provides a steady stream of people throughout the day and the service will serve as a good source of income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén lives with his wife. Both are a little over 50 years of age. He was initially a bricklayer, but because of his age, it was difficult to continue with that job, so he decided to sell cahuamanta (a manta ray and shrimp soup from Sonora) for a living. He started 5 years ago, setting up his cart on a corner until he was able to obtain a permit from the municipality so that he could establish his business and operate during fixed business hours.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to repair the vehicle with which he tows his business cart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rubén vive solo con su esposa tienen un poco mas de 50 años , el origen de su negocio fue que el era albañil y por su edad ya le era difícil continuar con este oficio y decidió poner su negocio de venta de cahuamanta. Comenzó hace 5 años poniéndose en las esquinas hasta que logro conseguir un permiso del municipio para poner su negocio estable con su horario correspondiente.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses el cual le servirá para reparar su automóvil con el que remolcan la carreta de su negocio.

loans.use: Repair work vehicle

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert B. is 32 years old. He is married with three kids who are currently in school. Albert is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts like radio sets, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and televisions. He would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Luon S., 37, is an impoverished entrepreneur and has a business selling fish in her village. Every morning she receives fish from her husband who works as a fisherman and then transports it on her bicycle and sells it from house to house. She typically makes about US$ 2.5 each day.

Her husband, Penh Kim, sometimes catches more fish and he also sells it to fishmongers after he provides some to his wife. This couple has four children, two of whom are students; two others are employed as garment workers. Luon is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more fishing implements so her husband can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing implements for her husband

loans.name: Fatou Binetou

texts.fr: FATOU BINETOU D. EST UNE COMMERCIALISE DES TISSUS BAZINS PAGNES TISSUS Q'ELLE ACHETE AU MALI, BURKINA FASSO, POUR LES REVENDRE AUPRES DE SES CLIENTS DE LA PLACE. ELLE A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 6 ANS. ELLE HABITE LE QUARTIER SOM DE THIES.
texts.en:
Fatou Binetou D. markets 'bazin' fabrics and 'pagnes' (colorful West African cloth) that she buys in Mali and in Burkina Faso in order to resell them to local customers. She has six years of experience. She lives in the SOM district of THIES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell pagnes and bath soap

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Kpémé, madame Adakou A. est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas exercer correctement son commerce et à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. En vue d’améliorer son revenu et de faire face à la demande de ces clients, elle sollicite ce crédit pour développer son commerce et faire plus de  revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et celles de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Kpémé, Togo, Madame Adakou A. is married and has four children. She sells groceries. Despite her best efforts, she is not able to run her business at a satisfactory level and cover her children’s needs. With a view to increasing her income and meeting the demands of her clients, she is requesting this loan to develop her business, top up her income and raise the living standards of her children and her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.en:
The Santa Barbara Village Bank consists of 20 members, most of whom are women. The group is part of FINCA Peru’s Wari Project, an effort to proviD. microloans to people who live far from FINCA’s Ayacucho office by sending loan officers out to the villages in which the clients themselves live. Fourteen group members live in the village of Santa Barbara, while six live in the neighboring villages of Huaynacondo and Ñeque.

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, but the most common economic activity is raising guinea pigs, or “cuyes,” a Peruvian delicacy. Some clients have just a few dozen guinea pigs, while others have many more. Gloria Susana, for example, has almost 500 guinea pigs, breeding, raising, and selling them to stores, restaurants and individuals to prepare.

Guinea pigs are very delicate, temperature-sensitive animals, so caring for them is quite labor-intensive. Many clients go out themselves at 4 or 5 p.m. each day to cut fresh alfalfa to feed them. Some other group members raise different animals, large and small, such as chickens, cows, and sheep, which they then fatten up and sell at livestock fairs.

Other group members sell dry goods and grains; many travel between Santa Barbara and the city of Ayacucho (which is about an hour away by car) to buy, sell or traD. their wares.

Most of the members plan to use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell, more young animals to raise, or more materials to make their products. Ambrosio, for example, buys seasonal local produce which he loads into a rented truck and brings to the city of Lima to sell. Right now, it is prickly pear season, so he will use his share of the loan to buy boxes of prickly pears. Leonardo is a basket-weaver, so he will use his loan to buy more reeds to make his baskets. Leonarda has a small store and also raises guinea pigs; she will use her loan portion to buy rice, sugar and soda to sell.

The group is pictured along with their loan officer, Hector (far right) and the Wari Project supervisor, Derek Visser (center).

loans.use: To buy young animals, prickly pears, reeds for basket-weaving, merchandise for stores, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Lorena López Martínez tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es viuda, Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor tiene 38 años de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 37 años trabaja por cuenta propia y su otra hija de 34 años que cursa el 4 año de la modalidad diurna su otro hijo de 30 años de edad no estudia y su hijo menor de 28 años que no trabaja, sus propósitos son de seguir con su negocio adelante para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es difícil mantener la situación económica en la que ella se encuentra por  lo que tiene que ayudar a su Mama y a su hijos sus deseos son de seguir luchando para darle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que sus deseos son de transformar su casa y darle un lugar adecuado donde vivir a sus hijos sus sueños son de administrar un negocio de tortillas donde posea una ayudante con la elaboración de las tortillas ya que a su edad no puede pasar mucho tiempo de pie.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y venta de frijoles, la ubicación de su negocio es en reparto Austria, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, ella inicia este negocio por que necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos para su familia y acude a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y decide comenzar con medio quintal de maíz por lo que logra ver los resultados de sus sacrificios y mas tarde decide establecer otro negocio como es la venta de frijoles ya que los vendía en un determinado tiempo pero debido a que el precio de este producto escaló  decide quitar la venta de fríjol y mas tarde retorna de nuevo a la venta de frijoles por lo cual es el destino del capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos como frijoles, maíz y leña ya que la inversión de su materia prima es importante para ofertarlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Lorena L. Martines is 54 years old, and is a widow. Doña Martina has 5 children. Her oldest son, 38, is self-employed. Her other son, of 34, is also self-employed. Her daughter, also 34, is in her fourth year of secondary school modules. Her son of 30, is not in his studies, and her youngest son of 28 doesn’t work. Maria’s intentions are to continue on with her business to support her family, given that it is difficult to maintain her current economic status because she has to support her mother and her children. Her wishes are to continue struggling to better their quality of life by transforming her house and giving her children an adequate place to live. Her dreams are to administrate a tortilla business, where she would be able to have an assistant with the production of tortillas, as her age does not allow her to spend a great deal of time on her feet. The economic activity that Maria participates in is the production and elaboration of tortillas, and the sale of beans. The location of her business is in the annexed region, Austria. She has had her business for 4 years, starting it because she needed a means of generating income to support her family. She started with the sale of tortillas, with the initial amount of 50 kg of corn, with which she saw the results of her sacrifices. Later, she decided to establish another business in the sale of beans, which she sold for a period of time, until the price of beans as a product escalated. Later, she returned to the sale of beans because it generates the appropriate capital to buy necessary supplies like beans, corn, and wood, because investing in raw materials is necessary so that she may offer her products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Ginger is known to be a great help to humankind. It is commonly used as an ingredient in food, a sore throat reliever and sometimes we believe it will make us a better singer. Fe E. and family have a Ginger Powder making business.

Fe E.’s house is situated at Sibucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur Province. Special Instant Salabat is what they call for their product. Fe started the business with an initial capital of PHP 500. Her husband is her partner in the business and usually does the mixture of the product. 

In preparation of their daughter’s education, they would like to earn more and thus want to expand their business. So, they ask for a loan of PHP 8,500 as an additional capital for their business expansion.

loans.use: additional capital for ginger powder making

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is a single parent and has 7 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rose sells food supplies like tomatoes, maize, cassava and plantain at Coronation near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1977. Rose uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamnan Choeum, 47, and her husband, Mr. Sam-orn Phoeung, 51, married in 1984 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a monk, one child is a garment factory worker, and another one attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chamnan has been a silk weaver since she was eighteen years old, a skill she learned from her sister. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Chamnan is applying for a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 44-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Tarek has owned a paper factory for thirty years. He produces paper. Tarek requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his factory. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan.

Tarek is speciA. because he has competitive prices and he produces good quality paper. His clients are companies. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Tarek decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his factory.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his factory

loans.name: Amirjon

texts.ru: Рустамов  Амирджон кредитор в Микроинвесте с 2006 года. Он занимается бизнесом по продаже мужского нижнего белья. Каждый свой займ он использует целенаправленно, на расширение товарооборота. Во время отъезда Амирджона  за товаром , на рынок торговать выходит его жена, как раз на снимке она сама. Его точка реализации расположена  в центре рынка города Худжанда. За товаром он ездит в Истаравшан два раза в месяц. Его жена благодарна Микроинвест,  за возможность увеличить в кредит свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Amirjon R. has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2006. He sells men's underwear. He uses each of his loans to expand his trade turnover. When Amirjon goes to purchase his stock, his wife sells it at the market (as seen in the photo). His trading stall is right in the middle of the Khujand city market. Twice a month, he goes to Istaravshan to buy his stock. His wife is thankful to MicroInvest for the opportunity it has given them to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling men's clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is married, has one child and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2007 she has sold food supplies such as rice, cooking oil, Milo and milk at Siwdo, near Cape Coast.  While Agnes works as a trader, her husband is employed as a teacher. Agnes uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities, and food. She will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for her business and with the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Una integrante de este comite es la Sra. Mariza M. L..  Ella tiene 27  años y tiene dos hijos. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y se didica en la confecion de ropas y lleva a vender en la ciudad de San Lorenzo a un comercio. A la venida ya compra la tela de la tienda para confecionar.  Tambien ella tiene su pequeño comercio en su casa.  Mariza agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya por el apoyo que se les da a travez del prestamo grupal porque mediante eso estan saliendo adelante.

Las otras integrantes son: 

Maria Elena Vazquez.	Venta de merceria
Elida V.. 	 Venta de merceria
Maria Fulvia M..	Venta deropa
Maria Irene M.. 	Vendedora Ambulante
Luciana G..	Venta de verduras.

Maria del C..	Vta de comida.
Isabel L.. 	Venta de ropas.
Marta O.. 	Venta de frutas.
 Fermina A..	Venta de ropas.
 Miryan A..	Recicladora.
Liz O..	Venta de Bebidas.
Teresa T..	Despensa.
Ancia C..	Venta de articulos varios.
Yohana G..  	Reciclaje.
Maria Natalia T.. 	Venta de plateria. 
Angela O.. 	Copetin.
Mariza M.. 	 Modista. 
Ester A.. 	Venta de frutas.
texts.en:
One member of this group is Mrs. Mariza M. López. She is 27 years old and has two children. She is a very enterprising woman and works making clothing that she takes to sell to a business in the city of San Lorenzo. Before she returns, she buys the fabric she needs from the store. She also has a small business in her home. Mariza thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support it gives through the group loan because with it they are getting ahead. The other members are: María Elena Vázquez - General merchandise sales Elida V. - General merchandise sales María Fulvia M. - Clothing sales María Irene M. - Traveling sales Luciana Gómez - Fruit sales María del C. - Food sales Isabel López - Clothing sales Marta O. - Fruit sales Fermina A. - Clothing sales Miryan A. - Recycler Liz O. - Beverage sales Teresa T. - General store Ancia C. - General merchandise sales Yohana G. - Recycler María Natalia T. - Silver sales Angela O. - Beverage sales Mariza M. - Seamstress Ester A. - Fruit sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of merchandise to sell

loans.name: San Men

texts.en: Y. San Men, 68, is a widow and earns a living by selling different kinds of meatballs near her house. She doesn’t have many responsibilities toward her family members since most of her 7 children are employed and get paid, though inadequately for their living. However, she wants to take a US$ 200 loan to expand her current business, selling more different kinds of meatballs for more income.

loans.use: buying more meatballs to sell

loans.name: Ysolina Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Ysolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios superiores (enfermera),  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para comprar cosméticos de la línea  Unique. 

Su deseo es ejercer su carrera y seguir alguna especialización.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos, los ahorros  y los beneficios que ofrecen a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Sra. Ysolina belongs to the Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa ["Powerful Women of Santa Rosa"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 23 years old, partnered and the mother of 1 son. She has studied nursing. She lives in the Revolucion neighborhood.

She began working with the Manuela Ramos movement, taking a first loan of S/.300 [300 soles], which she used to buy cosmetics from the Unique cosmetics line.

She most wants to practice her profession and follow some specialty.

What she likes best [about the community bank?] is being able to borrow easily, saving and the benefits they provide to women.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

loans.name: Chabor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Чабор  Бобоев животновод с 18 летним стажем работы. Очень опытный человек в сфере животноводства. Знакомые и соседи Чабора, которые начинают заниматься животноводством, часто обращаются к нему за советом. Этот добрый и отзывчивый человек готов всегда придти на помощь и дать дельный совет.
Жена Чабора Шоира домохозяйка, она уделяет особое внимание  воспитанию и учебе своих детей. 
 В откорме скота и переработке молока Чабору помогает дочь Мохира. Чабор подал заявку на получение кредита  для откорма скота.
Дополнительный семейный доход Чабор получает от продажи сухофруктов на рынке своего города.
texts.en:
Chabor B. has 18 years of experience in animal husbandry. He is very skilled in this field. Chabor's friends and neighbors, who begin to get involved in animal husbandry, often come to him for advise. This is a kind and receptive person, who is always ready to help and give business advise. Chabor's wife, Shoira, is a homemaker. She devotes special attention to raising and educating their children. Chabor's daughter, Mohira, helps him with livestock feeding and milk processing. Chabor requested this loan for livestock feeding. Chabor also receives supplemental income from sales of dried fruits at a market in his city.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean S. E. is 26 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province, where she owns farmland near her home on which she cultivates rice. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works in construction. This couple lives with three young children who are dependent on their income.

Ean S. E.’s rice crop is not so growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. To solve this problE., she is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase three sacks of fertilizer in order to fatten her rice crop yield. She is hopeful that, with this loan, her productivity will increase.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizer in order to fatten her rice crop yield

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El L. is 32 years old. Her husband, Sen, is 33. El and Sen have been married for many years, and they have 3 children who are still in school.

Sen spends almost all his time selling charcoal throughout the nearby villages. El grows rice on a plot of farmland that was given to her by her parents. She harvests and sells her rice crops twice a year.

El is seeking a loan in order to buy a buffalo for both her farmland and her husband’s delivery service. She dreams of someday sending her children to college.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her farmland and her husband's delivery service.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya, she is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 7 years old.

Jane has owned a cafe business selling drinks like soda, juice for 2 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks for her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut S., 28, is a professional decorates handicrafts living at home in the Phnom Penh. Since 2002, she been has using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living. She typically makes US$3 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Besides doing this business, she and her husband also work as farmers and sell chickens at the local market. Khut S. would like a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike she needs to transport chickens to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. is from the village of Manticao in Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Elma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma uses her trisikad, a bicycle-powered carriage, to provide transportation services to local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately  PHP a month from these activities.

Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services that she provides. This will be Elma's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is a hardworking person who lives in the village of Mozzozzin Norte, Sta.Maria Isabela. She is 30 years old and married to Fedrick, who is also 30. Fedrick is working in Maryland as a Booker (agent/manager). They are blessed with three children: Rizeth,15 years old and a junior high school student; Andrew Jerald, 13 years old and a first year high school student; and Elton Jhon, 11 years old and a fifth grade student.

As a mother, Jocelyn is hoping to provide the best future possible for her children. For that reason, she is striving hard to maintain her business, and hopes that someday she will be able to expand it into a more stable business. Jocelyn has been engaged in the hog-raising business for five years. She needs additional capital to purchase more hogs to raise and to buy a supply of feed. She is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders, which she will use to purchase a supply of feed for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan will be approved, because it will contribute a lot to the progress of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a supply of feed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Ikechi

texts.en:
Ikechi is 40 years old and is married with a child. He is engaged in the making and selling of bags and has been in business for the past eight years.

Ikechi believes that making good and quality bags will increase his sales. In order to achieve this, he is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more material. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase material to make more bags

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 55 year-old widow with five children. She lost her husband some years ago. She is a hard working woman who is very focused on her business and family life. She is a LAPO client.  LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria. Florence owns a restaurant where she sells Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She wakes up every day at 4:30am to start the preparation for cooked foods. She hopes to increase her profits this festive season. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and food to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
-Madame Oumy  Magane est une femme mariée d’une trentaine d’années qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est parente bénéficiaire, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2009. En ce qui la concerne c’est son mari qui l’a encourage dans le commerce de tissus, d’habits prêt a porter et divers autres articles .Ainsi elle l’a expérimenté pendant 2 ans et a toujours eu un résultat  satisfaisant. L ‘accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet d’une part d’augmenter progressivement son stock de marchandises et d’autre part de participer symboliquement aux petites  dépenses quotidiennes .Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs.
Madame Lo est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Madam Oumy Magane is a married woman of about thirty years of age who lives in the Camberene locality. She is a recipient parent, married and the mother of a child. She is a member of U-IMCEC Fund since November 2009. As far as she is concerned, it is her husband who encouraged her in the trade of fabrics, ready-to-wear clothing and various other products. Hence, she tried it for 2 years and had always had a satisfactory result. The increase in her pofits enable her, on one hand, to increase gradually her stock of goods and to assist symbolically with the small daily expenses. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs. Madam Lo is a benefiaciary of a protocol arrangement between U-IMCEC and the Program for Developement of Child and Family (PDCF) Seydina Issa Laye. PDCF tries to reduce poverty within the community and to protect especially children from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these destitute families can benefit from loans on more soft terms as compared to standard loans. Since the takeoff of this protocol arrangement in December 2008, 120 parents received funding for amounts which varies between 50, 000 and 150,000 frs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa.  Lucas vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Lucas tiene 52 años, es casado y tiene 7 hijos. Lucas se dedica a la agricultura donde produce verduras, papas, maíz y zapallos. Lucas distribuye en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco sus productos. Lucas y su esposa pertenecen a la asociación de productores de cultivos del “Valle Sagrado de los Incas”, que es bien reconocida en el Cusco. El socio Lucas nos cuenta que cuando no esta trabajando en su chacra se dedica a la construcción de casas.

El socio es un padre trabajador y ya son varios años que trabaja como albañil y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo su esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar mas semillas y después sembrarlas.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucas is a member of “PALCCARAQUI”, the communal bank of the Arariwa Association. He lives in Urubamba Province, department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is three hours away from the city of Cusco. Lucas is 52 years old, married and has 7 children. He works as a farmer and grows vegetables, potatoes, corn and pumpkins. He sells his products at the Huancaro market in the city of Cusco. Lucas and his wife are members of the “Valle Sagrado de los Incas” farmers association, which is a well-known organization in Cusco. Lucas tells us that when he isn’t working on his small farm he works in construction, building homes. He is a hard-working father and has worked as a bricklayer for several years now. He has done well thanks to his efforts and dedication to his work. He has asked for a loan to buy seed for his farm. Lucas is grateful for the opportunity extended to him and promises to pay back the loan according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requests a loan to buy seeds which he will plant in his farm.

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es: Leonor Del Carmen tiene 55 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y de comida, es madre soltera con 2 hijos que mantener. Ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante ya que tiene que ofrecer sus productos todos los días en las calles con el fuerte sol, esto le entusiasma mucho pues siempre se preocupa por sus hijos es una persona muy trabajadora y capaz pues hasta los momentos les ha proporcionado a su familia lo necesario es así como ella ha logrado aprender a mejorar la administración de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio. ella sueña con aumentar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Leonor Del Carmen, 55, sells meat and prepared meals; she's a single mother with two children to support. She sells her products in the streets and has to work daily under the relentless sun. She is excited about her work because she is always concerned for her children; she is a hard-working, capable person who has been able to provide for her family to date. She has learned to run her business better. The requested financing will be used to buy raw materials that she needs. Her dream is to have her business grow every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials.

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-to-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. Phina is married to a businessman and they have a lovely 4 years old child. Phina is 32 years old and she hopes to lift her business and her family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: New Foundation Business Group

texts.en:
T. H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called New Foundation Business. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children who range from 12 to 21 years old.  He is a bachelor degree holder.

For 10 years, T. has been running his medicine store at the Jacob Town and GSA road intersection in Paynesville. He sells standard drugs and talks to customers in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

T. plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more medicine.  His goal is to own more medicine stores and live an improved life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, T. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen akhtar wants a loan to buy iron rods to sell. Nazia Sakhi wants a loan to buy plastic utensils for her utensil-selling business. Anwari begum wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

Haleema is the group leader of the above-mentioned ladies. They all are citizens of a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan.

Haleema is 40-year-old married woman. She is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors and charges them accordingly. She has fixed charges for designer and simple-stitch dresses. She charges Pak Rs. 150 for designer clothes and Pak Rs. 90 for simple stitching. Her earnings allow her to pay for utilities. 

Her husband's name is M. S. and he runs a cloth-selling business. He purchases the cloth from various cities such as “Multan and Lahore” because of their good quality stuff and cheap rates. He has been doing this work for over 8 years. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 18,000 every month. Currently, he is in need of increased stocks in large quantity to complete the orders of his customers. Therefore, Haleema is asking for a loan worth Pak Rs. 20,000 which would be a great help for his business.

loans.use: Purchase cloth to complete orders

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight people who live in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. Mrs. Vanna V. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Aside from this business, she is a fruit and fish seller in the local market, and she is also a wedding decorator. Since her fruit and fish business are going well, she wants to expand. Thus, Mrs. Vanna V. decided to seek a loan to buy more fruit and fish for re-selling.  She is a widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and fish for re-selling

loans.name: 04 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Sen T. Thị (1) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Thiệu Hóa Thanh Hóa.  Sen is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04 Thiệu Hóa (04 Thiệu Hóa).


Sen is married and has 4 adult children.  To making a living, Sen works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Sen has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


Sen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sen is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is requesting a loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Sen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị Độ (2) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  T. Thị Ba (3) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Lê Thị Viên (4) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Lê Thị Huệ  (5) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


5.  Lê Thị Lan (6) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 1.486.800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


6.  Lê Thị Thư (7) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 1.062.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: M. Joachim is a hard-working businessman of thirty-two years old, married with two children of whom one child is going to school. He owns a cosmetics shop selling both wholesale and also on a retail basis. He has spent over five years in his business. He is using the loan to purchase boxes of jelly, shampoo, relaxers, cold waves, radiant, and weaves like Ripo curls, braids such as pony tails among others. His business dream is to attract more and more customers to his shop so that there may be an increase in daily business sales and his personal dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of jelly, shampoo, relaxers, etc.

loans.name: Jaime Leonardo

texts.en:
Jaime is 24 and lives with his grandparents in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra).

Jaime is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops. Jaime has been working as a salesman in a supermarket for more than 6 years. He purchases his products in a wholesale store. He requests this loan to buy pigs. His objective is to expand his small farm.

With this loan, he hopes to make progress towards achieving the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Seang Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Seang Hai S. is 36 years old and lives in Bang Bat village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Seang Hai S. decided to ask for loan to buy a water machine, pesticide and fertilizer to support her farming crop. Her husband, Mr. Cheng Pann, is a construction worker. He receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children. One of the children is attending the local school and one is just two years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, pesticide and fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel C. is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Samuel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services like motorcycle repairs to local community members. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Samuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used. This will be the first loan taken out by Samuel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria tiene 61 años, Hace más de 6 años trabaja con el destace de cerdo. Desde entones cada fin de semana ella sale a buscar los mejores cerdos para realizar su trabajo. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, porque le permite estar en el campo y apreciar del bello paisaje que rodea su comunidad, además la recompensa lo obtiene cuando realiza la venta de la carne. Su meta es tener otro negocio en el que pueda generar más ganancias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cerdos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Macaria is 61 years old. For more than six years, she has worked butchering pigs. During that time, she has gone out every weekend in search of the best pigs for her business. She enjoys her work very much because it allows her to be out in the country and to appreciate the beautiful landscape that surrounds her community, and furthermore, she is rewarded when she sells the meat. Her goal is to have another business so that she can generate more income. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase pigs in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es:
Felix Angel A. G. tiene 34 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 niños de 10 y 9 anos. 

Felix es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza sus compras de productos en Mata de Cacao cada 2 meses y se realiza la venta de sus productos en Matilde. 

El préstamo será invertido en la siembra de maíz y para la compra de abonos para mejorar la ida en el económico. Su sueño es tener buena vivencia y dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
 
Le gusta jugar indor futbol, boly, y salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Felix Angel A. G. is 34 years old. He lives in a common law relationship in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province. He has two children, ages 10 and 9.

Felix is a member of the El Placer (The Pleasure) rural communal bank, which is located three hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in all, with the majority engaged in raising corn and cacao. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the Cooperativa San José.

Felix works as a farmer raising corn, rice and cacao. He purchases supplies in Mata de Cacao every two months and sells his products in Matilde. The loan will be invested in seed corn and in the purchase of fertilizer in order to improve his standard of living. His dream is to have a good livelihood and to give a good education to his children. He likes playing indoor soccer, bowling, and going for walks.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed corn and fertilizer

loans.name: Edward Saitoti

texts.en:
Edward Saitoti M. is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last two years. Edward is 29 years old and he supports three people in his family. His spouse is Namuutui M. who assists him with his farming activities.

Edward learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. This will be Edward’s second loan of which he is planning to spend 25,000 shillings on plowing, 20,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and 15,000 on planting his ten-acre wheat farm.

Edward hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Edward’s dream is to do large-scale farming, to attain financial independence and to buy his own farm machinery. He is hardworking and determined to achieve his dream.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to pay for plowing, harrowing and planting

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es: La señora Luz Mariana tiene 33 años. Actualmente sigue adelante con su negocio como es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. En meses ha tenido problemas con la distribución de su producto, pero esto se debe a que las personas sin trabajo ahora están buscando como poner negocios, y este negocio de ropa usada es el más fácil de establecer, además que las ganancias son promedias. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene la demanda de sus clientes. Su sueño, es tener una tienda en el mercado de Managua, en el cual distribuya todos sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Mariana is 33 years old. She is pressing ahead with her business of selling used and new clothing. In some months, she has had problems with selling her products, but she credits this to people without work looking to start businesses, because selling used clothing is the easiest type to establish, and furthermore, the earnings are average. This loan is to buy supplies now that there is demand from her customers. Her dream is to have a store in the market in Managua, from which she could sell her products wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Alexandre Antonio

texts.es:
Alexandre de 57 años, tiene un taller de enderezadora de vehículos, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Inicio hace años atrás como aprendiz en un taller poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su pequeño taller en su casa para poder mantener a su familia, ahora trabaja desde muy temprano hasta acabar todo su trabajo. El pinta carros los endereza y los entrega listos para funcionar. 

Ahora quiere con el préstamo comprar materia prima como pinturas, metal. En el futuro quiere reconstruir su casa y el taller para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alexandre, 57, has a body shop. He lives in an urban neighborhood called "Las Orquídeas” which is so named because when it was discovered there were many orchid flowers there. Years ago he started learning his trade gradually in a workshop. As a result of his efforts, he was able to have his own workshop in his house to support his family. Now he works from very early in the morning to finish all of his work. He repairs the auto bodies, paints the cars, and delivers them ready to drive. Now he wants to have a loan to buy raw materials such as paints and metal. In the future, he wants to rebuild his house and workshop to give a better life to his daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paints and metal

loans.name: Meryline

texts.en:
"Industrious" is a characteristic that best describes Meryline A., a married 42-year-old. She and her partner were blessed with two children, a 14-year-old high school student and an 11-year-old 5th grader. The couple is full of hopes and dreams, especially for their children. As much as possible, education is their priority for their children, and also to provide their basic needs for a better life. 

Meryline joined Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI) - a partner micro-finance institution of KIVA - in the Philippines in 2006. The couple agreed on this decision to join the program. Her previous loans were utilized by financing a retail store. Today the store is their primary source of income aside from the income of her husband from his work. 

She is glad that she was able to help her husband with their financial needs without leaving her household chores, and was able to finance a new project from her earnings, which is doormat weaving. Now she is applying for a loan of 13,500 PHP to use as additional capital for buying grocery products to sell, such as canned goods, sacks of rice and sugar, cases of soft drinks, liquors, cigarettes, bath and detergent soaps, toothpaste, shampoo and assorted noodles. 

She is hopeful that with this new capital she can start saving in preparation for her children's future schooling and for renovation of their house. She is also planning to establish a new grocery store to increase her profit. She hopes that ASHI and KIVA will support her all the way in achieving her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
señora Luz M. de 31 años de edad, está casada hace 6 años con el señor Derlis Caceres de 30 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 2 hijas, una de 3 años y otra de 3 meses,  cabe mencionar de que es una mujer muy trabajadora, empieza su actividad a tempranas horas a ordeñar sus vacas y luego distribuye su producción usando como medio de transporte su moto.
	La señora cuenta con 7 vacas lecheras y tiene una producción diaria  entre 40 a 50 litros diarios que los pone a la venta, su terreno es de 6 hectareas y alimenta a sus animales con balanceados, caña dulce y pasto camerun, que ella misma cultiva. 
	Su marido se dedica a comprar queso y luego comercializa en la capital, aportando de este modo a la economia familiar.
	Esta mujer emprendedora solicita el credito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con eso aumentar su producción diaria y mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Luz M., age 31, has been married to Derlis Caceres, age 30, for six years.  They have two daughters: a three-year-old and a three-month-old. Luz is a very hardworking woman; she starts her work early in the morning to milk her cows and later delivers the milk using a motorcyle as a means of transportation.

Luz has seven dairy cows which allows her to produce and sell between 40 and 50 liters of milk daily; she feeds her animals a balanced diet of sugar cane and grass which she grows herself in her six-hectare plot of land. Luz's husband buys cheese and then takes it to the capital for retail sales; this way he contributes to the family budget.

This entrepreneurial woman is asking for a loan in order to purchase an additional dairy cow which would allow her to increase her daily production and improve her monthly income.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor Raúl Álvarez  y su esposa tienen un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años, donde ofrece variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes. En este momento ellos desean invertir en el negocio para con esos ingresos ponerle techo a uno de los cuartos que están construyendo y ya empezar habitarlos.
texts.en: Raúl Álvarez and his wife have had a business selling used clothing for 4 years. They offer a variety of styles and colors to their customers.  At this time, they want to invest in the business so that they can put a ceiling on one of their rooms that they are building in order to start living in them.  The person shown in the picture is Raúl's wife.

loans.use: To stock their business of used clothing.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Erick; El socio tiene 24 años de edad, el es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, el socio también trabaja vendiendo artesanía, el socio aprovecha que Ollantaytambo es un pueblo muy antiguo con un legado histórico único, el socio realiza trabajos de artesanía pero le rinde mejor si los compra al por mayor y los vende luego, entonces él se a dedicado a comprar del pueblo de Pisac artesanía al por mayor desde cuarzos, piedras preciosas, aretes, collares , llaveros entro otros diferentes trabajos y los vende en un pequeño local que el alquilo cerca al maravilloso complejo de Ollantaytambo su pequeño espacio. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de artesanía ala por mayor. 

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Erick is a member of the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo", which is located in the district of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Erick is 24 years old, married, and has two children.  He works in agriculture, but also sells handicrafts.  Ollantaytambo is a very old town and he would like to make the most of its unique historical legacy.  He has made handicrafts, but knows that it is better for business if you buy them in bulk and sell them later.  He would like to buy crafts in the town of Pisac like quartz crystals, gemstones, rings, necklaces, and key chains, among other items.
