He will sell them in a small store that he rents near the wonderful complex of Ollantaytambo.  

He is asking for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of handicrafts at wholesale prices.

He is thankful for the loan and promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 44 años, que es electricista,  y sus 2 hijos menores que estudian en el colegio, juntos cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer se las ingenia para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, y por esta razón se dedica a varios oficios a la vez como por ejemplo: a  la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo a clientes ya conocidos; otro de los negocios que tiene, es el servicio de cosmetología, cuyos clientes siempre piden de su trabajo, por la habilidad que tiene en las manos para cortar el cabello y hacer peinados. Hace algunos años estudio cosmetología, pero no se dedicó por completo a esta labor pues sus hijos estaban pequeños, hoy quiere trabajar con mayor intensidad en este oficio. Le gusta mucho su labor como peluquera pues se entretiene y le genera regulares ganancias, también brinda el servicio de cosmetología a domicilio, lo que marca la diferencia. Aunque no tiene aún su propio salón de belleza tiene planeado para el futuro instalar uno en sociedad con una amiga. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunos materiales que necesita para continuar peinando, además de tintes y líquidos para desarrollar mejor su labor.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and lives in a home of her own, alongside her husband, 44 year old Jose, who works as an electrician, and her two young children who attend school.  They work each day to get ahead.  Each day, this entrepreneurial woman uses her ingenuity to help her husband out with the constant household expenses.  For this reason she runs several businesses, such as: beauty product sales via catalog to current customers.  She also has a cosmetology business, where her customers request her service because of her ability to cut and style hair.  She began studying cosmetology a few years ago, but she did not complete the course because her children were very young.   Now she would like to work in this trade.

She enjoys working as a hair stylist because she understands this business and it brings her a good income.  She also provides in home service, which sets her apart.  She doesn’t have her own salon, but plans to set one up in partnership with a friend.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises to make all of her payment on time because she doesn’t want to be in bad standing with those who have made this support possible so that she can continue to work and move ahead.

Ana plans to invest the money from this loan in some supplies that she needs, such as hair coloring and other liquids that she needs for her business.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Alimahmadjon

texts.en:
Alimahmadjon K. is a hardworking person, and he makes an effort to give his family the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.

With experience gained over four years in the purchase and sale of cattle Alimahmadjon has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase more cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 7500 TJS. Alimahmadjon thanks you very much.

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en:
Nheb V., 50, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. V. is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day.

The family has to spend USD 44 on food, USD 2 on electricity supply, and USD 21 on other necessary expenses every month. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa de 50 años de edad es soltera, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 años como Secretaria del Consejo. Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez para terminar el cuarto y construir un sumidero e instalar los servicios higienicos, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con kiva ya que le ha permitido mejorar su casa y brindarle a su familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Maria Teresa is 50 years old, single, and has worked for the City of Juigalpa as Council Secretary for two years.  She is requesting her 8th loan with the aim of continuing to improve her home.  With this loan she would like to finish a room, build a drain and install bathroom facilities so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.  She says that she feels very grateful to Kiva as they have allowed her to improve her home and provide her family with more comforts.

loans.use: To build a drain

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with an eleven-year-old child who goes to school. She has been operating a chemist's shop for the past six years.  She was previously employed in a hotel.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to meet her financial obligations. 

She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 80,000 Kes to expand her business premises and buy medicines and cosmetics.

loans.use: To expand her business premises and buy medicines and cosmetics.

loans.name: Karisisi Enole

texts.en:
Karisisi Enole K. is 33 years old and married with six children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Karisisi learned about KADET from a registered women's group with KADET. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to use to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to advance the farming and buy more cows. Karisisi's dream is to buy a plot of land and educate her children. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy seed and to weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum C., 27, is a garment worker in Takeo province, and earns about $3 a day. She is married and has one child who is still living at home. Her husband makes a living by raising poultry and growing rice, and also earns about $3 each day. Hum has applied for a loan for $700 to help her husband expand his business by buying fertilizer and more pigs to raise. We see Hum C. here with her husband in front of their home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pigs.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is into the production and sale of "Fante kenkey" and fruit at Takoradi. Efua has received senior high education.  Her husband is currently unemployed and so she has to bear the burden of supporting the family alone. She has four children. With this burden at hand, Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family. She has been in this trade for six years. She plans to reinvest her additional income for further growth.

loans.use: Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her husband is a driver and he provides his family with their basic needs from his earnings. 

For the past four years, she has operated a food vending business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Masika also owns real estate houses, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With the 70,000 KES she is requesting she wants to purchase building materials, iron sheets, timber and to pay labor. Masika dreams of installing electricity in her home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, iron sheets, timber and to pay labor.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña francisca tiene 41 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la agricultura, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Inicio el negocio por que en su familia se lo enseñaron, tiene un año de esta atendiéndolo, trabajado todos los días.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería e insumos agrícolas, ya que quiere sembrar una parcela de terreno, con este préstamo llevara a cabo las inversiones y contara con más ingresos en un futuro.
Su aspiración es aumentar su negocio de verduras, generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is 41 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with her husband and two children.  She sells vegetables and is a crop farmer, which is the business her family taught her.  She has been doing this for a year and works every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies so she can plant a patch of land and increase her income.

Her goal is to expand her vegetable business and make more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizer)

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor S. is 36 years old and lives in the Tsakhkunk village area of Sevan. Gor is married and has a daughter and a son. 

Gor and his wife sustain their family by means of farming. They work very hard and they raise cows and calves, sheep and lambs. 

Gor intends to enlarge his farm, which will allow him to earn more in the future. Therefore he is asking for a 1,000,000 Armenian dram (AMD) loan to buy five sheep and four calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and four calves for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children. He is from Lebanon. He is the main income provider of his family. He has 22 years of experience working as a farmer. He has been managing his own farm since 1990. His farm produces all types of vegetables, which are all distributed to local agricultural markets. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase agricultural spices and seeds. In addition, he will buy some supplies needed for his work in order to improve his business.  He expects that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices, seeds and supplies

loans.name: Cristhian Carolina

texts.es: Cristhian casada, su esposo ingeniero le ayuda económicamente en los gasto del hogar. Juntos como familia requiere realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de la vivienda para protegerse de los vándalos por la zona donde viven. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, piedrines, estribus y otros materiales para levantar el muro de la parte del patio. Obteniendo seguridad comodidad y protección.
texts.en: Cristhian is married and her husband is an engineer and he helps her financially with the household expenses. Together as a family, they need to make some improvements to the infrastructure of their house to protect themselves from vandals in their neighborhood. With the loan they will purchase construction materials: cement, sand, construction blocks, construction stone, gravel, steel, and other materials they need to build a wall around the patio, to obtain greater comfort and protection.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en: Ma. Erma is single and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a furniture making business in the Philippines for 5 years. Ma. Erma has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. In the future, Ma. Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité la inició la señora Constancia domiciliada en el Barrio San Francisco Britez Cue a 75 km de la oficina de Curuguaty.
El comité fue denominado “San Francisco” y actualmente está en el segundo ciclo, con 13 integrantes, su primer ciclo culminaron sin ningún inconveniente, es un grupo de señoras muy trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades tales como: venta chancho, nafta, queso, venta de comidas, despensa, etc.
Las  integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr un mayor rendimiento en sus actividades.
Las mujeres manifestaron estar muy emocionadas por el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya por ser la empresa que confió en ellas y le dio la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas a través de su trabajo, y poder desarrollar el trabajo en equipo.
La sra. Emilia se dedica a la venta de carne de chancho, ella compra cerdos y los engorda para luego poder faenarlos para la venta mayoritaria, pues de esto obtiene un buen margen de ganancia, lo cual la ayuda al fin de  mantener a su familia, superar la pobreza y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos especialmente.
texts.en:
Constancia, from the San Francisco Britez Cue neighborhood, 75 kilometers from the Curuguaty office, started this group.

The committee was named “San Francisco” and is now in its second loan cycle with 13 members.  
It completed its first cycle with no problems.  The committee is made up of hardworking women who are involved in different types of businesses such as: selling pork, gas, cheese, prepared food, packaged food, etc.  The members all were working before they started the committee of Entrepreneurial Women and they united to achieve more  from their businesses.

The women are thrilled by the support from the Fundación Paraguaya because it’s an organization that has confidence in them, and has given each one of them the opportunity to improve the quality of their lives through their work, and they have been able to develop their businesses as a team.

Emilia sells pork.  She buys the pigs, fattens them, and slaughters them to later sell the pork to a wholesaler.  That is how she gets good earnings which helps support her family and lifts them from poverty to offer a better standard of living, especially to her children.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child. Her child is not in school.  Phiona has a business of tailoring, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits to take care of herself. She would like to buy clothes for herself. In the future, Phiona hopes to build a house of her own. Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en: In the picture, Magaret is standing in front of her provisions shop at Dompoase, a village near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. She responsibly assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy sugar, milo, and milk (provisions to sell). She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milo, and milk for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child.  His child is not currently in school. John has a boutique that sells clothes which he has had for one year. He has a barber shop as his second business. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, John hopes to add more stock to his business. John is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal town. He lives in his own semi-permanent house together with his children. His dream is to build a permanent house that can accommodate his whole family. He has been in the transportation business for four years now and he says he has so far encountered no big challenges and his dream is to own at least five motorcycles. John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for business purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business purposes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry, hot season the availability of water for sale is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to meet her customers' needs.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a tank for water storage. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a tank for water storage.

loans.name: Mobil

texts.ru: Mabil 20 let. On nejnat. Mobil yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Kalbadjar seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim bratom. On seychas nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit masla dlya prodaji, uvelichiv svoy tovar on xochet razvit svoy bizness. Mobil uje qod kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix masel dlya mashin ( mmatornoye, tormoznoye i t.d maslo)
texts.en: Mabil is 20 years old and single.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region together with his brother.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy oil for sale.  Having increased his merchandise quantity, he wants to develop his business.  Mobil has been involved in selling various types of automotive oils (engine, brake, etc.) for one year.

loans.use: to buy oil for sale

loans.name: Reveca Severiana

texts.es: La Sra. Reveca se dedica desde hace 10 años a la comercialización de juguetes. Ella empezó trayendo juguetes desde la ciudad de La Paz y dejando en los mercados de Santa Cruz al por mayor, actualmente tiene su puesto fijo en el mercado donde le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela, también entrega juguetes al por mayor,   La familia consta de su hijo y esposo. El crédito que se va ha financiar es para capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar juguetes para esta época de fin de año ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas. Tiene experiencia en créditos ya  que constantemente saca para capital de trabajo, es una persona muy emprendedora con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Reveca has sold toys for ten years. She started bringing toys from the city of La Paz and selling them wholesale in the markets of Santa Cruz. She now has her own stall in a market. It is going very well for her and she has many customers. She also sells toys wholesale. Her family is made up of her son and her husband. Her loan is for working capital. She wants to buy toys for the end of the year season, since the Christmas holidays are coming up. She has experience with loans because she is always taking them out for working capital. She is a very enterprising person with a desire to get ahead. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane est un jeune tailleur  de 24 ans qui a 11 ans  d’expérience dans son activité. C’est un métier  qu’il a choisi par amour. Il habite au Sénégal dans l’un de ses banlieues.  Tout ce  qui  lui plait dans son activité c’est la connaissance, le social, et le besoin de s’autofinancer. Il est célibataire et membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis 7 mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat dune machine a coudre. Son objectif est de développer son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Ousmane is a young tailor of 24 who has 11 years experience in his activity. He chose his profession by passion. He lives in Senegal in one of its suburbs. The things that he likes about his business are the knowledge, the social contact, and the necessity to be self-financing. He is unmarried and has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC offices for 7 months. He requests a credit of 50,000 Frs. in order to purchase a sewing machine. His objective is to develop his business.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy ready-made garments to increase his sales and earn better profits. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. In these years, he has achieved a good clientele base by providing timely services and a variety of garments. 

Zubaida herself is a skillful lady. She operates a sewing business at her home. Her husband is involved in the tye-dye business. Her remaining children are also involved in different works. Her eldest son is in a mobile-phone selling business. Her third son helps his father in his business. Her youngest son does sewing works. Her daughter has completed her education until 10th standard and now does sewing and embroidery works at home. All her children are contributing to the family financially from their earnings. Zubaida is hopeful that her son’s business will improve further after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments for selling.

loans.name: Ranulfo

texts.en:
Ranulfo is 44 years old and married. He has two children aged 23 and 24. Ranulfo has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. He sells items like sugar, soft drinks and canned goods. Ranulfo earns about 4500 PHP per month with his business. 

He plans to use his loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. Ranulfo hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Hajran's Group

texts.en:
Hajran is 42 years old and illiterate, but she has the skills of sewing clothes. She uses her skills to earn profits for her family and pay for utilities. Hajran is also a very good housewife who performs her household duties very well along with her sewing works. 

Hajran is the mother of seven children. She couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions, so all of them stay at home and don’t do anything.
 
Her husband is a building contractor. He builds buildings and houses on contract. He is a hard-working person who provides good quality services to his customers. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of both her husband's and her own businesses. Her husband will buy construction tools and she will buy a new sewing machine. The loan investment will help both Hajran and her husband improve their businesses and increase their income.
 
Both of them are hopeful that an investment will help them improve their business condition. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah passbook) is Hajran.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Merry Fellowship Group

texts.en:
Grace is the facilitator of the Merry Fellowship group. Grace and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, a reliable supply of inputs (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

Grace takes care of 15 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her children and ensure food security for her family. 

In 2012, the members of the Merry Fellowship group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta tiene  44 años, es casada y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano José Carlos Mariátegui en el Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. 
Se dedica desde hace 25 años a la preparación y venta de comidas y bebidas.  Ella prepara estos productos en su vivienda y luego los vende en su puesto de venta de comida en su localidad.  Con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.
Alberta desea adquirir más insumos para ampliar su producción y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Asimismo desea adquirir más materiales para ampliar su negocio de venta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Alberta es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Alberta is 44 years old, married, and lives in a home of her own located in the José Carlos Mariátegui settlement in the Tambogrande district of the Piura region, four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

For the past 25 years she’s been preparing and selling food and drinks.  She makes these things in her home and then sells them from a local food stall.  She moves her family ahead with the income.

Alberta would like to acquire supplies in order to expand production and increase her profits.  In this way she also wants to acquire M. supplies to expand her business.  In order to meet her objective, she’s seen fit to request a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Alberta is a very responsible woman, dedicated to her family.  Her greatest desire is to see her family progress and enjoy a better quality of life.  Those who know her consider her to be very friendly and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Muungano Group in Western Kenya! Eulitah is the facilitator of the Muungano group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Eulitah takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eulitah had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eulitah was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eulitah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Eulitah will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Eulitah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is married. He has 5 children. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor cost and to buy seeds and fertilizers for rice production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sitio la en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
 
Ella es maestra en una  escuela particular de la zona, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella vende los fines de semana y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia en su lugar de trabajo cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada 8 días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  7 años  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y confiables.
 
Sus sueños es tener local y un nombramiento de maestra en una escuela pública.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" communal bank meets every two weeks in La Pila in Montecristi canton. This place is well-known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by its inhabitants, following their traditional customs. 

This is where we met Flor. She is 36, married, and has two children, ages eight and two. The eldest one goes to school. Her husband operates a taxi. She is a teacher in a private school in the area, but also works selling clothing of all kinds. 

She sells door-to-door on weekends, and also sells to her co-workers and to mothers at her workplace, when she is unoccupied. She sells her products on credit, and collects every week. She goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise every time she needs to.  

She has been working at this activity for more than ten years, and it's going very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

She has been in the communal bank for seven years, and likes it because her fellow members are a close-knit group, and are reliable. Her dream is to have a shop, and a teaching position in a public school.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en:
Lamia is a 62-year-old widow from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Lamia has a home-based project in which she trades in clothes in addition to doing embroidery. Lamia is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes for resale.

An aspiration of Lamia's is to have her own shop to better display her products and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat was born in 1959 year. He is hardworking man. Nemat is married and has 2 children. He has been busy with animal husbandry more than 20 years. Little by little with the passing of the time year he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the animal good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells animal in the local market and has many customers. Many of his customers are local butchers who are glad from his work. 
Nemat is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to sell

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is aged 57 and married with six children. Her family lives in a village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is housewife, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver in a local area. The current business earns her about 53,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Phea has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now applying for a loan to buy zinc for renovating her house. She hopes to have a decent house for the family to live in.

loans.use: to buy zinc for renovating her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Santos Tomasa

texts.en:
My name is Santos R. and I sell mangos. I have had my business for 3 years and it is located in the neighborhood "los pinos" in Tegucipalga. I have good customers and my business is situated in from of a public school. My business generates an income that supports my family; my goal is to increase sales in order to improve my shop/stand and especially to help with the education of my children.

Mi nombre es Santos R., me dedico a la venta de mangos, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años y esta ubicado en la colonia los pinos de tegucigalpa, mi clientela es muy buena ya que mi negocio esta ubicado enfrente de una escuela publica, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mis ventas y asi poder acondionar mejor el lugar de la venta de mangos y especialmente el estudio de mis hijos

loans.use: Compra de mangos, sal, pimienta, chile, bolsas, cuchillos, agua

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydia wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is a resident of the Beylagan region. He is 59 years old. He is engaged in cattle breeding as most people in rural areas are. He breeds cattle, sells them, or slaughters and delivers meat to butchery shops. He currently has two cows. He wants to buy a new cow for breeding and when it calves, the number of livestock will increase. He has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan. Ne needs to borrow $500 to buy a good cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is a 52-year-old grandmother and a  woman of great distinction in her village. She's on the executive board of the local Womens Union and the Farmers Union. Besides that, she runs  an herbal shop with her 53-year-old husband. She has great knowledge of herbs and plants, so she prepares and buys them, while he sells the herbs at the shop. They live in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles southeast of Hanoi. Besides the herbal shop, they also have rice paddies and raise chickens. She wants to invest more in her herbal shop and wants to finish her bathroom. That's why she applied for a new loan. 
The profit of their shop is $187.50 per month.

loans.use: Buy more herbs for her shop and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin married in 1994 and has 4 children, one son and 3 daughters. She has been in business buying and selling fish since 1990. Her husband has been a construction worker in the local community for more than 6 years. With the business Sarin is in, she has been able to send all of her children to school.

Sarin is asking for a first loan in the amount of $300 from MAXIMA. She plans to use that money to expand her business purchasing and selling fish in the community market. She feels certain she will be able to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish and selling to the community market

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is 35 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. Maria runs a foodstuff business which she started in 2002. She has always been an active and enthusiastic entrepreneur. She is requesting a loan of US$ 175 to increase her available capital. She believes that the profit she will be able to generate will not only help her keep a stable position in the market but will also offer a better livelihood for her children.

Maria has been a role mode of discipline, accuracy, and responsibility. Difficult family circumstances and ill-health have not hindered consistent growth in her business. We believe her hard work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her little shop

loans.name: Egam

texts.ru:
Egam J. has been processing timber for over 20 years. His son helps him in this business. Processing and sales of timber business is his sole source of income. He would like to obtain a loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Джуманов Эгам занимается переработкой лесоматералов около 20 лет. В этом бизнесе помогает его сын. Переработка бизнеса является его основным источником доходов.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is an active, enterprising 23 year old mother. Since she married her husband Edy, she decided to open a small grocery store at her mother’s home. While taking care of her two small children, she works at her food store from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

Her husband works as a driver in a transportation company in their city of Juliaca. They both are working, so that they can attain their goal of building their own house. Currently Sabina is requesting a loan which will enable her to increase the variety of her products. With the profits that she will obtain, she will try to reach their goal sooner.

Let us facilitate her loan so that this self sacrificing mother can soon rest in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Sabina, es una activa madre emprendedora de 23 años, desde que se caso con Edy , su esposo, decidió abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes en el domicilio de su madre. Mientras ella cuida a sus dos hijos menores, también se dedica a atender su despensa desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche.

En tanto, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte rural de su ciudad , Juliaca, y entre ambos anhelan construir su propia casita; con ese fin se esfuerzan y trabajan arduamente, por el momento Sabina solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá ampliar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos, y con las ganancias que obtenga tratar de cumplir en corto tiempo su propósito.

Posibilitemos su petición para que esta abnegada madre pronto pueda descansar en las instalaciones de una casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of more quantity and variety of products for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana C. lives with her family in Rudozem, near Smolian, Bulgaria.  Rudozem is a  tourist town in one of the greatest mountain regions of Bulgaria, the Rhodope Mountains. Mariana and her husband are teachers and she teaches English at the town's school.  Because of the tourist development in the region, Mariana decided to start bed and breakfast business and rent two of the rooms in their big house. Therefore, Mariana has applied for a loan of $775 (1,000 BGN) to make repairs on two rooms she wants to rent.

loans.use: To improve bed and breakfast accommodations.

loans.name: Isoboeva

texts.ru:
M. Isoboeva who is 27 years old, is married and is a mother of two children. She is in the retail business of selling fabrics for curtains. She has secondary education and was not able to study at the university because her family could not afford it and she had to start earning money since she was very young. Her husband is her only support in this business. She began taking out loans in 2003 and proved to be as a brave, punctual and a very responsible client of MicroInvest. She had $200 in assets when she took out her first loan and which have now increased up to $550. In the future she plans to sell wholesale and improve her vendor space.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исобоева Мавлюда- 27 лет. Замужем ,мать двоих детей .Занимается торговлей тканями для штор Образование среднее так как уровень жизни в семье не позволяла ей учиться в университете а зарабатывать на жизненные расходы уже с детства. Опорой в сфере торговли является ее единственная опора ее муж. Начала кредитоваться с 2003-го года и за это время проявила себя как мужественная, пунктуальная и очень ответственная клиентка «Микроинвест». Начала кредитоваться с активами на 200$ а сейчас они достигают 550$.В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу и улучшить место торговли.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This is Ahmad, son of M. Y.. He is 20 years old and he is the owner of an internet club. He lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan right now.

Ahmad wants to improve his business so he decided to buy some computers and other necessary materials for his club. For that reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1050 from AFSG.

loans.use: To buy some computers

loans.name: Comite Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these women the energy and motivation to reach success.

Yolanda A. contacted her friends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire of changing their world for the better by working very hard. Yolanda’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The members of the commitee are involved in many different business activities such as the sales of cosmetics, food, gift wraps, cloths, jewellery, cleaning products and drinks.

The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase

1. Food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc;

2. Drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; and

3. Clothes such as T-shirts, socks, pants and shoes

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, vegetables, pastas, etc; drinks such as Coke, beers, wine, soft drinks; clothes such as t-shirts, socks, pants and shoes.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang K., 38 years old, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband and two children. Chheang works as a farmer making US$3 per day, while her husband, Hao Chang, raises ducks for US$6 each day. Farming has been difficult in Cambodia over the past year and many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. She has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase more ducks to raise. She hopes this will help expand her husband’s business, consequently raising the family’s daily income and improving their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase ducks

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George A. Warden sells provisions and fishing items. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for George and his 4 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Kety Rosana

texts.es:
Kety is a member of the La Familia (The Family) Communal Bank, situated in Jr. Alfredo Eglinton # 179 of the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 38 years of age and is the mother of one young child. Her husband is a farmer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, she decided to invest in the sale of fruits.

Kety currently has a grocery store in her home. In the mornings, she tends to her store with the support of her husband, and in the afternoons she goes out to sell her fruits and beverages.

With this loan of S/ 1.600, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of provisions for her grocery store such as one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, half a case of milk, 2 cases of bathroom tissue and sodas.

Kety is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for the support and the loan she has received that enables her to continue expanding her business each day. This is how she continues to work day after day to succeed and offer the best for her young child.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Kety, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en Jr. Alfredo Eglinton # 179, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años es madre de un pequeño niño y su esposo es agricultor. Kety con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de frutas.

Kety, en la actualidad tiene una bodega en su propia casa. Ella en las mañanas se dedica a su bodega ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y en las tardes ella sale a vender sus refrescos y frutas en un grifo.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1.600 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su bodega como 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, ½ caja leche, 2 paquetes. Papel higiénico y gaseosas.

Kety, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo brindado ya que le da la oportunidad de brindarle un crédito para así poder seguir surgiendo en su negocio cada día más y es así que día a día ella lucha por salir adelante y brindarle de lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase provisions for her grocery store such as one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, half a case of milk, 2 cases of bathroom tissue and sodas.

loans.name: Mrs. Tol Lorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank in Traeuy Troeng Village in Kandal Province has 15 members. They hope to use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Tol L. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates her crops twice a year. In the rainy season, she cultivates rice and also grows vegetables in the dry season.

Her husband, Mr. Chorn Horn, is a candy and ice-cream seller. Since his business is going well, he wishes to sell it door-to-door. Unfortunately, he does not have a mode of transportation to carry this out. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Tol L., has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy a motorbike for her husband's business.

Mrs. Tol L. is a 32-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one, aged five years old, is too young to work or study. Mrs. Chhuon S. could not provide a photo of herself so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband's candy and ice-cream business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=40575&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva. Rosa es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo de 13 años, Rosa se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates ayacuchanos, que elabora sola y de manera domestica, actividad que aprendió mientras trabajaba, sus insumos los adquiere al por mayor, el cacao lo compra en la selva ayacuchana, en los últimos meses sus ventas se incrementaron porque vende a tiendas mayoristas, su producción se ha incrementado.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar. Rosa sueña con que su hija progrese, sea profesional, ampliar su negocio y tener una empresa.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=40575&_tpos=1&_tpg=1 Rosa is a partner in the "Agua Viva" Communal Bank. Rosa is 29 years old and lives with her husband and 13 year old daughter. She makes chocolates typical of the city of Ayacucho. She makes it by herself in her home, and she learned the trade while she was working. Rosa acquires her supplies wholesale. She buys cacao in the Ayacuchan jungle. In recent months her sales have gone up because she began selling at wholesale stores, and her production has increased as a result. Rosa needs a loan of 1050 soles, which she'll invest in sugar. Rosa dreams of her child progressing in school, becoming a professional, expanding her business and having a store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1050 soles which she'll invest in sugar

loans.name: Balitwegomba Women's Groupa

texts.en: Nimba N. is a very hard working lady with a business selling used clothes in the daily markets in Jinja.  She is a member of Balitwegomba women’s group and is a single lady, but she decided to join this trade to be able to cater for her children, especially to pay school fees to give them a brighter future.  She has hope that with their education, and after getting decent jobs, they will be able to cater for her during her old age.  Nimba has customers in all markets.  She goes to Kampala once or twice a week to buy a bale or two of clothes.  These days she has even started to buy from Jinja, and this saves on the transport costs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for retail.

loans.name: Alfonso Ines

texts.es: El Sr. Alfonso tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur de la capital de Managua, casado, tiene dos lindos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad que son independiente y trabajan por su cuenta, pero le ayudan a sus padres don Alfonso es pastor de una pequeña y humilde iglesia, que poco a poco se ha ido construyendo, pero todavía falta. Sus planes como familia es contribuir con la enseñanza de la palabra de Dios a los hombres, pero especialmente la construcción en la fe hacia nuestro señor Jesucristo. Son cinco años de conducir a su rebaños por los caminos de Dios y luchando contra las adversidades de los enemigos. Los planes a futuro del pastor Alfonso es la culminación de la Iglesia pero esto  requiero de un préstamo que Gracias a Afodenic lograran comprar materiales como: cementos, hierro, ladrillos, piedras, perlines, para terminar de construir, lo cual va hacer de gran beneficio para el pueblo ya que las puertas estarán abiertas, en un local seguro
texts.en:
Alfonso is 58 years old, and a resident of the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua, he is married and has two beautiful children, 20 and 25 yearsold, who are independent and work on their own, but they help their parents. Alfonso is the pastor of a small and humble church, which little by little has been being built, but it is still not done. Their plan as a family is to contribute with the teachings of the word of God to men, but especially the construction in faith toward our savior Jesus Christ. for five years he has driven himself on the path of God and fought against the adversities of his enemies. The future plan of Pastor Alfonso is the culmination of the Church but this requires a loan, which thanks to Afodenic they were able to buy materials like: cement, sand, stones to finish the construction, which is going to be a big benefit to the people since the doors will be open in a safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to finish the building

loans.name: Serey

texts.en:
Mrs. Serey C. is a farmer in Sarika Keo village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. In addition to her farm, she owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phoeung Heang, makes beds for sale. His business is going well and he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Serey C. asked for a loan to purchase the necessary materials and equipment.

Mrs. Serey C. is 27 years old and the mother of three young children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase bed-making materials and equipment.

loans.name: La Solucion Ii Group

texts.en:
Group 2 from La Solucion (The Solution) Bank of Hope is located in La Barquita, a very impoverished community in Sabana Perdida, on the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. The members are very excited about the opportunities this first loan could provide for their businesses, which include lingerie, vegetable, and clothing sales. They all dream of improving their economic conditions, hoping to provide better lives for their children (the five are mothers), and eventually moving into houses in a better area of the city.

One of the group members, Julissa, who will start a shoe-selling business with this loan, stated in the meeting that she has set herself the goal of having her own car in two years. She said to the loan officer: “When I have my car, I will come here to this office and take you for a ride.”

These ladies are determined to progress through hard work. Let`s help their dreams come true. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to start a shoe-selling business.

loans.name: Víctor Albino

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Albino I. padre de familia, tiene 2 hijos los cuales actual mente están estudiando y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
Don Víctor Albino esta pagando lo que es el puro terreno y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros empezó a construir al grado de terminar su vivienda pero nada más le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior  para tenerla terminada y darle a su familia un patrimonio segura.
texts.en:
Victor Albino I. is the father of a family, and has two children who are actually studying and he wants the best for them. Victor Albino is paying what is actually just land, and with much strength and savings he started to build the degree to finish his home but he is no longer doing it because he lacks the exterior and interior items to have it finished and give his family a secure home.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exterior and interior finishings

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Monsieur A. charles habite le quartier d’agoe telessou au nord de la ville de lomé, il  fait comme commerce la vente de farine de blé qui est très utilisée dans la cuisine  togolaise pour préparer la pâte,il achète les sacs de blé et transforme le blé en farine à l'aide d'un moulin il fait ce commerce depuis 2004. Il est divorcé de sa femme, les deux enfants qu’ils ont eu sont à sa seule charge. le stock de farine dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de bien faire face à la demande de ses clients, il demande à wages un prêt  pour l’achat de  sacs de blé.
texts.en:
Mr. Charles A. lives in the Agoe Telessou neighborhood in the north of the city of Lomé. His business consists in selling wheat flour, which is very much used in Togolese cooking. He buys sacks of wheat and turn it into flour using a grinding mill. He's been running this business since 2004. He's divorced from his wife, and he is alone in supporting their two children. The amount of flour he currently has does not enable him to meet customer demand, and he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES to purchase sacks of wheat.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of wheat

loans.name: Timinandiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les cinq femmes qui composent le groupe Timinandiya  ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de KOULIKORO république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de mariage et de voisinage et  font essentiellement  le commerce de charbon de bois.
 Dans l’intention de faire assez de stock et de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle elles ont adhéré à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter 5 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de TINGOLE et des villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre au bord de la route principale BAMAKO-SEGOU. Le charbon de bois est conditionné dans des sacs de 100kg et vendus au comptant à une clientèle composé essentiellement de voyageurs qui passent pour Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Ces femmes comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux.
texts.en:
All of them married, the five women who make up the group Timinandiya average 29 years of age and 3 children. The group members live in traditional conjugal families in the village of Tingole in Fana sub-prefecture (Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region) in the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through ties of marriage and community, and they essentially do commerce in charcoal.

Intending to build up enough stock to satisfy customer needs, they’ve joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their sixth group loan, four of which were agricultural. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid.

With this loan, these women intend to buy five tonnes of charcoal from charcoal suppliers in and around Tingole in order to resell it along the roadside of the main road connecting Bamako and Segou. The charcoal is packaged into 100-kg sacks and sold in cash transactions to customers composed essentially of travelers on their way to Bamako (capital of Mali).

These women plan to obtain through this loan a profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to help the spouses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 43 years old and married with two children. She sells medicines in her shop.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Kodjovi Tinin

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’agbalépédo qui est un quartier situé au nord de lomé,il est un tailleur, il a ouvert un atelier qu'il a appelé« TINO EXCLUSIVE FASHION ». il confectionne des habits pour hommes qu'il revend. il a beaucoup de clients ce qui fait qu’il réalise d’importants bénéfices sur ses ventes.certains de son matériel de travail étant épuisés et voulant acheter des tissus pour confectionner de nouveaux habits,il s’adresse à WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 3 rouleaux de tissus, 2 paires de pagnes « WAX », 2 paires de pagnes « HI-target », 2 paires de pagnes « SUPER ». il est marié et père de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in Agbalépédo, a district located in northern Lomé. He is a tailor and has opened a workshop he calls "TINO EXCLUSIVE FASHION". He makes clothes for men and sells them. He has many customers, which means he makes a good profit on his sales. Because he's exhausted some of his supplies, and because he wants to buy fabrics for making new clothing, he's inquiring with WAGES and requesting his first loan to buy three rolls of fabrics and two pairs each of WAX, HI-Target, and SUPER brand pagnes (colorful West African cloth). He is married and the father of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is forty-seven years old. She is a divorced mother of three children – all daughters. The youngest is in the senior high school while the rest are out of school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Esi is a trader. She sells cosmetics such as pomades, body spray, powder, and body lotion, and she also sells footwear. She buys her goods from Kumasi and hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community. Esi also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her youngest daughter to the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza J. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 26 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena tiene 53 años D. edad,  vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto D. primaria, tiene 5 hijos y solo 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Elena se dedica a a la venta D. ropa para niños, caballeros y damas.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro abarrotes como: arroz, azucar,aceite,fideos,papas, gaseosas, golosinas, etc que vendía en su tienda. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. prenda D. vestir.
Con este crédito D. S/ 2,000 soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. ropa para caballeros, damas y niños.
También comprará útiles escolares como: cuadernos, colores, lapiceros, lápices, goma, tijeras, etc
Elena  tiene como adecuar un espacio en su domicilio para poder vender los utiles escolares y poco  apoco anhela tener una librería .
texts.en:
53-year old Elena lives in the district of Laredo, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a businesswoman, has completed 6th graD. of primary school, and has five children, only one of whom is still financially dependent on her. She earns her living by selling clothing for children, men and women. With her first loan of 300 soles Elena bought food items such as rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes, soft drinks, and candy which which she sold in her store. Currently she only sells clothing. With this loan of 2,000 soles she will buy more clothing for men, women, and children. She also plans to buy school supplies such as notebooks, crayons, pencils, pens, erasers, scissors etc. She has maD. space in her house from which to sell these items, and hopes one day to open a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and school supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Rafiki borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are 19 and 15 years old.   

Ester has had a tailoring business for 12 years. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Ester’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more material. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to do repairs, pay school fees, improve her home, get more food for her family and expand her business. 

Sikudhani, another member of the Rafiki borrower group, has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business of selling charcoal and bites.

loans.use: to buy more material

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina C. V. tiene 49 años y estuvo casada por más de 20 años pero su esposo la abandono y ahora vive sola. Tiene 2 hijos para los cuales saco un préstamo para poder comprarles un equipo de soldadura y así puedan trabajar. La señora Delfina vive en la comunidad de Maica Sud en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba y a las vendedoras de Charque (un plato tradicional de Cochabamba que se come acompañado con queso). La señora Delfina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 32 años.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de Alimento para su ganado (Challa) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanza para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitan. De este modo no tendría problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso ni la calidad bajarían. La señora Delfina espera poder obtener otro préstamo una vez finalizado este para poder comprar más vacas y aumentar su producción de leche y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Delfina Chamba V. is 49. She was married for over 20 years, but her husband abandoned her. She now lives alone. Her two children got a loan to be able to buy soldering equipment and be able to work. Delfina lives in the Maica Sud community in Cochabamba. She has three cows. She uses their milk to make cheese and sell it at different markets in the city of Cochabamba and to people who sell “Charque” (a traditional dish eaten with cheese in Cochabamba). Delfina has been making cheese for over 32 years. The loan is to buy food for her livestock (corn husks). Due to drought problems, the cost has increased a great deal. She does not have enough to buy all of the food that the cows need. This way they will not have trouble producing the same quantity of milk that they now produce. Also, the quantity and quality of cheese will not be reduced. Delfina hopes to be able to get another loan once this one is finalized to be able to buy more cows and increase her milk production and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her milking cows (corn husks)

loans.name: Vikie

texts.en:
Vikie D. is from the town of Aloran. She is 35 years old. Vikie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vikie operates a retail rice business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Vikie has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vikie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vikie is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Vikie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Buyonjo 2 Abdalah Fatuma Group

texts.en: A. Fatuma is the group representative of the Buyonjo 2 group. She is thirty-one years old and married with seven children, who are all in school. She has been selling new clothes since 1999. She is using this loan to to purchase new gentlemen's and ladies's clothes to sell. She is active woman who encourages women in her community to work hard and set up any business they can manage, rather than being lazy and totally dependent on husbands and relatives. Her dream is to obtain a good house.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Chhen S. and her husband. The mother of one teenaged child who attends school, Chhen earns a living by farming rice, while her husband is a construction foreman. S. hopes to earn extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase pig food and piglets to raise from her home.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and piglet to raise from her home

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang K. lives in Pour village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. San Touch, is a pig breeder. Although this couple tries to work hard, they don't earn enough ncome to support the household. Now Mrs. Yeang K. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the fruits to sell. She is 53 years old and the mother of three children who are also fruit sellers. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the fruits to sell.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Baby Jane C., 42 years old, is a resident of Purok 4 Maquilao, Tangub City. She is married to Mr. Marcelo C. who works as a casual contractor at Cagayan de Oro City. She is blessed with two children aged 12 and 17 years old.

Baby Jane is engaged in the direct selling of Avon products and longganisa (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) and has been in this business for four years. She is able to earn a minimum of P4,000 per month from these business activities.

Considering that Baby Jane has two children, her husband’s salary is not enough to support the needs of their family, especially in raising their children. That’s why she engaged in dealing Avon products and longganisa to help her husband.

As a good member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP Program (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), Baby Jane is given the privilege of obtaining her 7th loan of P4,000. She is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She also expresses her pleasure of being a member of Paglaum MPC because she can obtain the products and services offered by the Coop to all its members.

The proceeds of this loan will be added to Baby Jane’s capital and the income will be used for their daily needs and in repaying her loan.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry has been managing a retail store in her village for almost ten months now. She is 25 years of age and married to Roel, who works as a company driver in their village. They have one daughter named Glory Antonette, four years old. They reside peacefully in the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. One of their sources of income is the salary of her husband, but his income is insufficient to meet their daily needs. Cherry's weekly net income is 500 Philippine pesos (PHP). She desires a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to increase the income from her business. She wants to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Ingrind

texts.es:
La socia INGRIND pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo varón. El mayor estudia en el jardín y ella esta embrazada. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación (taller de carpintería).  y venta de muebles 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. La socia tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone para en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ingrind belongs to the Mercamueble Communal Bank. She lives in the Imperial city of Cusco. She is in a common law marriage, and she has a son. He is in preschool, and she is pregnant. She has a small business (carpentry shop) of making and selling furniture. She alternates her activities between the home and making furniture like desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, and beds, etc. She helps her husband make and sell the furniture. She has a furniture selling stand in the Mercamuebles Market, which is located at the first bus stop in the San Sebastián province of Cusco. She has been doing this for many years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of making and selling furniture. She wants to buy raw material (wood) and materials like thinner, shellac, sandpaper, and glue, etc. for finishing the furniture. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital for her business of making and selling furniture

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently all her children are independent. She is sells smoked fish and started her fish sales forty years ago at a community market where she lives. It is through this business that she was able to cater for her children until they became independent.

Ama buys fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She says it is very affordable from that place, though that is quite a distance. With her little capital she cannot buy in bulk and sees that as a cost to her operation, considering the distance where she purchases her stock. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

Ama buys fish from the fishmongers sometimes when demand is high. She has a large customer base who travel from other parts of surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Diène est une nouvelle adhérant e  de la caisse de Camberene. Elle habite dans la même localité .Elle est parente bénéficiaire qui n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt dans l’institution.
