Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée dans le commerce et s’adonne à la vente de draps et de pots de fleur depuis plus de 10 ans. C’est une femme d’une cinquantaine d’années mais tres dynamique. Elle se procure ses marchandises a Dakar et les vend a Saint Louis. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs L’objet de ce prêt est de renforcer son stock de marchandises.
 Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Diène is a new member of the savings bank in Cambarene, where she lives. She has not had any previous loans. She is married with five children. She is an experienced businesswoman who has sold cloth and flowerpots for more than ten years. She is in her fifties but very energetic. She buys her goods in Dakar and sells them in St Louis. She is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to build up her inventory. Ms Diène has benefited from an agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (The Children and Family Development Program) of Seydina Issa Laye. The purpose of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and primarily to protect children from disadvantaged families. This agreement has provided their parents with loans on more flexible terms than are available from conventional sources. Since the agreement went into effect in December, 2008, 120 parents have had loans varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Garcias Group

texts.es:
El grupo Garcias está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Martha Irene M. de 49 años quien vende frutas y verduras, Claudia M. R. desde hace cuatro años vende frescos y gaseosas y Melania C. se dedica a la venta de verduras.
 
Ellas desean salir adelante progresar y mejorar sus negocios por ello con el crédito compraran mayor cantidad de productos lo cual les ayudara a aumentar el negocio.
texts.en:
The Garcías Group is composed of three hardworking women: Martha Irene M., 49 years old, sells fruits and vegetables; Claudia M. R. has been selling soft drinks for 4 years, and Melania C. sells vegetables. They wish to get ahead, make progress and improve their business, which is why, with the loan, they will purchase a greater quantity of products which will help increase their business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, potatoes, yuca, melon, etc

loans.name: Meme

texts.en:
Meme T. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Meme owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Meme joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle to provide better service and also to buy spare-parts. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Meme plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle and to buy spare-parts

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza S. is from the village of Lawigan, in Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Riza is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Riza has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This loan will be the 1st loan Riza has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To puchase additional milk, sardines and onions.

loans.name: Azra Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Muniran wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) for her decorative embroidering business. Naseem Un Nisa wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Azra parveen is the wife of M. A. A. and lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. She has given birth to three children and all of them are getting an education from a local school. 

Azra is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors. She utilizes her income to pay the utilities. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries (lentils, cooking oil, and rice) to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Yaba

texts.en: Yaba B. is 48 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" THIECKENE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time. Madame B. raises chickens. With this loan, she wants to buy new chicks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Nasibjon

texts.en:
Nasibjon is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his three beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and devotion as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 7 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. 

Nasibjon would now like to purchase the cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 1000 USD. Nasibjon thanks you very much for your kindness to others.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Jaguru

texts.en:
Jaguru M. sells soft drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of soda and mango juice to sell  She is 30 years old and married to a soldier. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy crates of soda and mango juice to sell

loans.name: Yoselina

texts.es:
Yoselina de 30 años de edad es casada, habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa junto a su familia comopuesta por su esposo el Sr. Jose Ruiz y sus 2 hijos Carlos de 10 años y Marilú de 7 años, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Yoselina es una pequeña comerciante de este municipio, tiene una pequeña pulperia donde vende productos para el consumo familiar y ademas tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende comida corriente.  

Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, reparando las paredes de los cuartos, el piso y el techo que se encuentra en mal estado y quiere hacerlo antes que inicien las lluvias.  

El mayor sueño de Yoselina es poder tener una casa bonita en donde sus hijos puedan crecer con seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Yoselina, 30, is married. She lives in the city of Juigalpa with her family which includes her husband, José Ruiz, and her two children, Carlos, 10 and Marilú 7, both of whom are in primary school. Yoselina is a small business owner and has a small convenience store where she sells basic goods. She also has a small storefront where she sells a set menu. She is requesting this 5th loan in order to make home improvements, repairing the walls, floor and roof which are in poor shape and she would like to do so before the rainy season starts. Yoselina´s biggest dream is to have a nice house where her children can grow up in a safe and comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof, floor and walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
Lucina es una madre de familia de 64 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, refrescos y otros productos en los exteriores del hospital de la ciudad de Chepén, esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos con los cuales apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la familia. El negocio goza de buena acogida, sus principales clientes son las personas que llegan a visitar a sus familiares enfermos y los transeúntes que circulan permanentemente por la zona.

Adicionalmente vende estos productos en su domicilio cuando no se encuentra en los exteriores del hospital. Lucina se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de más mercadería para ampliar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos.

Lucina es una mujer trabajadora, ella nos comenta que esta ocupación la hace sentirse activa y que desea seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su esposo a sustentar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucina is a 64-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Chepén, an agricultural and commercial zone in the province of the same name, about an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque. She has made a living for a number of years selling soft drinks, refreshments, snacks and other products outside a hospital in Chepén. This provides her with income to help her husband provide for the family. Her business enjoys success, and its main customers are passersby and people coming to visit sick relatives. Additionally, she sells these products out of her home when she's not at the hospital. Lucina is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to use to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales and income. Lucina is a hard-working woman, and she tells us that her job makes her feel active and she wants to keep working so she can help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seven people who live in Bat Lvea village in Kandal province. Mr. Chea H., age 38, is the village bank president.  He was selected for this role by the other members, who will use their portions of the loan for various purposes. 

Mr. Chea H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultitvates rice for a living. He is also the village chief and a wedding chef while his wife, Mrs. Tho Loem, is a dessert seller and also supports her husband on the farm. The couple have four children; three are students in the local school while the youngest, age 5, does not attend school yet.  With their various occupations, Mr. Chea H. and his wife are able to earn a small income to support their family. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, which he will use on his farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
Fannie is married to a secondary school teacher and has 3 dependents.  She sells used clothing and food items in Makeni.  Fannie has 10 years of experience in business and was initially financed by her husband.

Fannie needs a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to purchase more used clothing and food items.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her children to University level and support her husband who is finishing building a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania Del Socorro, ella tiene 30 años. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de calzado, Ella ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó  con muy poco dinero pero con el paso del tiempo fue ahorrando de lo poco que pudo obtener ha mejorado. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, tenis, zapatos de vestir entre otros así tendrá una gran variedad que ofrecer. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un tramo grande para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivania del Socorro, 30, is a footwear merchant. She has been in this line of work for 6 years. She started out with very little money but, as time went by, she saved and with what she was able to save she acquired the little she has and has improved. She is asking for funds to buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes and dress shoes, among others in order to have a wide variety of stock on hand. Her dream has always been to set up a large sales space to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon C. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Corazon is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Corazon raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be Corazon's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine V., from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental, is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as rice and corn grits, dried fish, canned goods, pancit, milo, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC that was used both to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her second loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Geraldine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Ortizer

texts.es: Ortizer es un hombre honesto lleno de amor, tiene 51 años y vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani; con su esposa Gloria de 48 años y los hijos de ella, Cecilia de 15 y Excer de 11 años a los que quiere como si fueran suyos. Hace 5 años, que se dedica a sembrar plátano, café, carambola, maíz y yuca y demás productos que crece en la selva, lo que gracias a su calidad, los vende en su propio terreno a los compradores que le visitan constantemente. Lo que más le gusta de la actividad que desempeña es rozar (quemar las plantaciones antiguas, para poder sembrar otras), ya que está seguro que le darán buenas cosechas, ahora con la ayuda de su banco comunal puede sembrar sus propios terrenos, “ahora ya no soy peón de nadie”, afirma. Dentro de sus planes futuros piensa cultivar sus terrenos agrícolas, que por falta de dinero dejó abandonados, además participará de un proyecto de reforestación por lo que plantará plantas ornamentales y maderables para trabajar correctamente con el permiso del Estado peruano. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son cumplidos, agradecen por el apoyo, a todos los intermediarios, que les ofrece una nueva vida con oportunidades. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 7 sacos de abono orgánico (abono natural), además de decenas de plantas de café que plantará en sus terreno agrícola que recientemente habilitó.
texts.en:
Ortizer is an honest man full of love.  He is 51 years old and lives with his wife, 48 year old Gloria and her children, 15 year old Cecilia, and 11 year old Excer, whom he loves as if they were his own.  They live in his own home, located in the native community of Pumpuriani.  Five years ago he decided to plant bananas, coffee, star fruit, corn, yucca, and other crops that grow in the jungle.  Thanks to their quality, he is able to sell his harvest to buyers who visit him constantly on his own land.

What he enjoys most about his work is burning his fields after the harvest. (This removes the old growth to make way for new plantings.)  He knows that this will provide him a good harvest.  With the help of his communal bank, he is able to plant on land of his own.  He tells us, “Now I am nobody’s farmhand.”

His future plans include planting on the rest of his land, which he had abandoned due to his lack of funds.  He will also participate in a reforestation program and will plant some other ornamental plants and trees so that he can work properly and with the permission of the Peruvian state.

This will be his fifth credit through MFP and together with the other members of the communal bank, he is grateful for the support of all the intermediaries who have offered them new lives with opportunity.

He will use the money from this loan to buy seven sacs of organic fertilizer (natural fertilizer) and scores of coffee plants that he will plant on his farmland that he recently prepared.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him A. S. is a single mother of three children, two of whom are married and live away from home while the other is employed as a garment worker overseas. Her husband died of senility many years ago.
Him A. S. buys fish in bulk from a place that is full of fishermen. She then hurries to bring the fish to the busy market, where she sells them retail. Him A. S. is a hardworking woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of increasing customer demand, she is applying for a loan to purchase more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Saguinto Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento integrado por  8 integrantes de los cuales 5 viven en la misma zona del km. 13 urbanizacion Arcoíris y urbanizacion Campo verde y las demás viven en el barrio de San Lorenzo.  
Su Actividad: servicio venta De comida, venta de ropa, cosméticos, etc.
La Presidenta es la Sra. Cristina modista hace 5 años, trabaja en su domicilio ya que cuenta con el material de trabajo propio, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tela para la confección de sus prendas ya que le hicieron pedidos de poleras. Su Estado civil: concubina con el sr. Benigno y tienen tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.
                                                                                                              Secretaria La Sra. Mariela  vive en el barrio San Lorenzo hace 1 año, su actividad es venta de comida en su domicilio concubina con el sr. Luis el cual es mecánico y tienen un hijo en su poder, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos.
                                                                                                              Tesorero: Román  su actividad es albañil, vive en la urb. Arcoíris km. 13 y trabaja cerca a la zona donde vive, concubino con la Sra. Carolina la cual se dedica a labores de casa y cuentan con 2 hijos a su poder.  Son personas responsables y puntuales y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico y la motivación de superación en sus negocios y actividades.
texts.en: Venture bank consists of 8 members of whom 5 are living in the same area of Arcoíris and Campo Verde and the rest live in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo. Their activity: selling food, selling clothes, cosmetics, etc. The President is Mrs. Cristina who has been a dressmaker for 5 years. She works at home and has her own work materials. The money from the loan will be used to buy fabric for the creation of the garments as she has already received orders for t-shirts. She is living with Mr. Benigno and they have three school-age children. The secretary Mrs. Mariela has lived in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo for 1 year. Her business is selling food at home and she lives with Mr. Luis who is a mechanic and has a son. With the loan they will buy ingredients for the preparation of their meals. The treasurer, Román, is a mason. He lives in the area of Arcoíris and he works in the district near to where he lives with Mrs. Carolina. She is a stay-at-home mother with two children. These are responsible and punctual people and they are grateful to this institution for the financial support and motivation to excel in their businesses and activities.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and ingredients for meals

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen K. is 37 years old and married to Hellen Mwithia. His children are John Kiprop, 13, Carren Jepchirchir, 9, Kiptoo, 6, and Martin Kipkoech, 4. Stephen has been operating a beauty salon for nine years as his primary business. He also practices dairy farming. His monthly income from the business is KES 24,000 with additional income from milk sales.

Stephen is borrowing KES 50,000 for a period of 12 months. He plans to use KES 25,000 to purchase stock for the salon in order to meet the demands of Christmas holiday customers and KES 25,000 to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Stephen will use the profit from the business to expand it by buying more machines, such as dryers, for the salon. His hopes and dreams are to expand the business and even open a big wholesale cosmetics shop to supply other beauty operators.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the salon and to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Sorbeh Turn Table Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rugiatu was born in Makeni city, about forty years ago. She is married to a contractor and the couple has four children. 

Rugiatu sells market food – rice, onions, tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, groundnuts, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for twenty-five years now. With her share of this loan, Rugiatu is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Purchase inventory in large quantities for sale

loans.name: Peter Kamande

texts.en:
Peter Kamande is 30 years old and married to Florence Wanjiru, who contributes to the family income. They have three children. Peter has been running his motorcycle transport business for two years with an income of 3,700 Kenyan Shillings (Kshs) per month.

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying the previous one. He hopes to buy a car for hire and to give his children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To add to savings for the purchase of another motorbike.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia de 41 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos la mayor estudia la universidad y el menor esta en edad preescolar; Rosa Amelia labora para el MINED de Acoyapa como docente desde hace 20 años. Esta solicitando  su 9no credito con el objetivo de poner la ceramica al piso de su casa ya que actualmente solo esta embaldosado y desea ver mas bonita su sala, ademas si el dinero lo permite desea poner azulejos al baño, para asi ir mejorando su vivienda y poder darle a sus hijos un ambiente digno.  En la foto Rosa Amelia esta con su hijo menor de 4 añitos.
texts.en: Rosa Amelia is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  Her eldest child is studying at university and her youngest is a preschooler.  Rosa Amelia has worked as a teacher for the Ministry of Education in Acoyapa for 20 years.  She is requesting her 9th loan with the goal of laying ceramic tiles on the floor of her home as she would like  her living room to be more beautiful.  Also, if the money stretches far enough, she would like to put glazed, ceramic tiles in her bathroom so that she can continue improving her home and provide her children with a decent environment.

loans.use: To lay ceramic tiles

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is 27 years old,  married, and has one child. She lives in the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be Maricel's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells shoes.  She is 28 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband also works in commerce.  Esther has had her store for 4 years and employs one other person to help her manage.  Her store is packed with shoes and open between 7am and 8pm.

Esther will use the requested loan to purchase more shoes in a bid to improve her profits.  She plans to continue to reinvest into her store to ensure it is running well.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van C., 25, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 37 on other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo A. tiene 61 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ayudar a los nietos con la educación.

Le gusta ver la televisión en especial los noticieros.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo A. is 61 years old, married, and lives with his wife and eight children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Pedro is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of continuing with his work and helping his grandchildren with their education.

Pedro enjoys watching television, especially the news.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Chadia

texts.en:
Chadia is 38 years old, married, and has three children between 5 and 16 years old. 

Chadia sells peanuts, dried fish, and sunflower oil, and has done this business for 10 years, which has enabled her to develop herself and her family, while paying for her children’s school fees. 

With the loan, Chadia wants to reinvest in her business by buying more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts, dried fish and sunflower oil

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 34 años,  su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una madre responsable y emprendedora tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo que este negocio por lo que tiene que mantener a sus  hijos que son menores de edad. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes pues siempre sale a vender sus diferentes productos a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como tratamientos, shampoo, perfumes, cremas, sombras entre otros productos, pues hasta los momentos tiene bastante pedidos que le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 34 years old.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She has been in this business for more than 2 years.

Maria is a responsible and enterprising mother who has three children in her care.  Her business helps her to support her children who are all still dependent on her.  Maria has a wide range of customers and she is always out selling her products to her neighbors, friends and family members.  She needs this loan to buy supplies such as treatments, shampoo, perfume, creams, eyeshadows and other products as she has a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy treatments, shampoo, perfume, creams, eyeshadows and other products

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is currently in a business of selling beans and cooking oil. She is 28 years old and married with three children; only one of them goes to school. 

Sabina borrowed a loan to stock more beans and cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Matogoma

texts.fr:
Madame  Matogoma K.  est âgée de 30 ans, mariée  et résidant avec son époux à Lafiabougou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Matogoma K. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de couture il y onze années. Son atelier de couture se trouve non loin du nouveau marché de Médine où elle dispose déjà de 3 machines dont 2 machines de broderie et 1 machine simple. Madame Matogoma est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso quelque mois. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechange pour ses trois machines et une partie pour payer des tissus pour les coudre et ensuite les revendre afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matogoma K. is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Lafiabougou, a district on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After attempting several different activities without success, Matogoma K. was introduced to sewing 11 years ago. Her sewing shop is located near the new market of Médine, and she already has three machines, two for embroidery, and the other a standard machine. Mrs. Matogoma is in high demand for the quality of her services.

Wanting to better serve a steadily increasing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few months ago. This is her first individual loan, which she will use to buy spare parts for her three sewing machines. She will also buy fabrics to sew and sell. This will allow her to meet the needs of her growing customer base. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used primarily to cover family expenses, to pay the interest on the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, and spare parts for her sewing and embroidery machines

loans.name: Women Of The Future Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel surgió por contacto de la Directora General con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 6º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2009.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Marisa, ella se desempeña como directora de finanzas, tiene 3 hijos dos mayores y una pequeña, su marido es comerciante  y ella tiene un local de venta de ropas en el nuevo circuito comercial.
Cuenta la Sra. Marisa que el crédito que espera recibir lo utilizará para la compra de ropas para volver a surtir su mesita, y poder mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que desean con muchas ganas sobresalir.
texts.en:
This group from the community of San Miguel came together following a contact from the Director General with the organization. This group is on their 6th loan cycle. They have been with Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) since 2009. 

One of the members of this group is Marisa. She is the director of finances. She has 3 children, two are grown and one is a girl. Her husband is a merchant and she has a clothing store in the new commercial circuit. 

Marisa says that she hopes to invest her loan in the purchase of clotting to supply her business and to improve her income and that of her family. 

All of the members of the group are women who very hardworking fighters who are very eager to excel.

loans.use: compra de ropas, pantalones, camisas, remeras, poleras, camperas, busos, etc.

loans.name: Jekadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKADI II sont des femmes toutes mariées, vivant à Kapala, dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, au moins 5 enfants. Le village est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 17 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du pois de terre. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leur activité agricole, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Elles sont à leurs premiers cycles de prêt de campagne. 
SALI compte utiliser son prêt de façon suivante: achat d’un sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Ces équipements et intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client..
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Jekadi II group are married woman who all live in Kapala in large, traditional extended families. They are 31 years old, and have an average of at least 5 children each. The village is a regional capital and is around 17km from Sikasso, the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They cultivate peas for a living. 
In order to generate greater profits from their agricultural activities, the members of the group are seeking funding from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme.  They are on the first loan cycle. 
One of the group members, Sali, aims to use her loan in order to purchase nitrogen powder and two bags of soil complex; the rest will be used to pay labour and hoeing costs. These tools and materials will be purchased from the large market at Sikasso. Following their harvest, the products are stocked for a certain length of time in order to accrue in value before being sold at the large market of Sikasso for retail or wholesale sales to a varied customer base. Sali aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back the loan and the family's everyday expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural ingredients and to pay labour costs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel trabaja en las Fuerzas Armadas de Bolivia. El crédito los usará para la compra de Uniforme y equipo que necesita para continuar sus estudios. Vive en casa de sus padres en el barrio de Bolonia de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en: Daniel works in the Bolivian Armed Forces.  He will use the loan to buy his uniform and equipment he needs to continue with his studies.  He lives in his parents’ house in La Paz’s Bolonia neighborhood.  He’s single and does not have any children.  This is his first loan request.

loans.use: to buy his uniform and equipment to continue with his studies.

loans.name: Salwan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old and married.

Salwan has had a shop for entertainment and electronic games since 2008. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate and enlarge his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate and enlarge his shop.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 47 years old. He comes from village Shemokmedi, West Georgia. Josef lives with his wife Manana and their 7 year old son. The son goes to school.

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, the family has 5 milk cows. They sell milk and other dairy products at the local market. Also, they have 500 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold to the wholesalers, seasonally. Josef also runs a bee-keeping business, which consists of 20 beehives. Total average monthly income of the family is 390 Laris (GEL-Georgian Lari).

Josef has requested credit for purchasing an additional 3-4 bee-hives and bee-colonies. Also, a small part of the credit will be used to purchase fertilizers for fertilizing the land in the nut-garden. As a result of these investments, the family will get more honey and increased harvest of nuts in the relevant seasons. These increases will positively influence the income of the family. Josef and Manana hope that the increase in income will allow them to renovate their house to make it more comfortable and quiet.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee-colonies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school. Yusuf has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for one year.  He has a butcher shop as his second business.  
	
To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yusuf hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Yusuf hopes to expand his business.  Yusuf is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program (SEP), program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him solve his financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Bakyara Twimukye Group B

texts.en:
Having that enterprise, that pro-activeness, that poise, that tenacious grit and the ability to deal with the mental and physical demands of running any kind of business are some one of the invaluable keys to business success. Most businesses in Uganda unravel on the basis of the fact that most people plying them have a one-track mind, are impatient and are, in most cases, rushing to make quick profits.

Most entrepreneurs, however, go to great lengths to enforce growth in their business undertakings. One such Ugandan is an assiduous and good humored mother of two who goes by the name of Rosette. She operates her food sales and small farming businesses in Ntungamo, in the West of Uganda. She principally grows and sells bananas and sells her food in one of the biggest food markets in the aforementioned district.

Rosette is a teacher by profession and she sees her engagement in the food sales trade as a means of enhancing her income. Needless to say, most teachers in Uganda get low remuneration. This, in most cases, means that most make-do with the help of a side business. Weekly, Rosetta's gross sales income totals up to 120,000 Uganda shillings.

Rosette intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more high grade manure for her banana farm. She anticipates better yields thereafter, which will mean better profits.

loans.use: to purchase more high grade manure to use on her banana farm.

loans.name: David Bern

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de uma menina de 2 anos. Fez a 6ª classe, vive numa casa alugada com sua familia e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe.

 Passa a sua infância ao lado da Avo materna, começa a trabalhar na empresa Aguas de Namaacha como Operador de Maquinas, é funcionario permanente ha mais de 5 anos trabalha das 7h as 17h auferindo mensalmente 4.700.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa.

Nunca trabalhou com nenhum Banco, este é o primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia e blocos) para dar continuidade da sua obra de construcao da sua casa. Conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas que também são clientes da instituição.

Este confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros empréstimos e dar ainicio de um negócio.
texts.en:
David Bern was born in Namaacha District. He is 32, married and has a little girl who is two years old. David Bern finished sixth grade. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports his mother.

He grew up with his maternal grandmother. He began working as a Machine Operator at Aguas de Namaacha (a bottled water company). He has been a permanent employee for more than five years and works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm, earning 4,700 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses.

David Bern has never worked with other banks. This is his first Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, sand and blocks) so he can continue to build his house. He learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution.

He is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of time so he can take out more loans and begin a business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand and blocks).

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a hard-working woman who is married and has one child. For five years, she has been engaged in a farming business and cultivates fruits and vegetable crops. Gulshan is the main breadwinner, considering that her husband works as a construction workman and his monthly salary is 70 USD.  The income she gains is about 250 USD per month. In this business her husband helps her in order to improve their standard of living.

The income she earns from this business allows her to take care of her family. Gulshan needs to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. Gulshan would like to get a loan of 1000 AZN for purchasing fertilizer for her land, which can allow her to get a good harvest. It is the first loan that she has requested and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Asomdwee Odzi Mu Group

texts.en:
Gifty is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She is a hardworking trader, selling smoked fish. Fish is widely used in cooking as one the most common source of protein. It is mostly used in the preparation of soup and sauces. Fresh fish is partially roasted on a fire to obtain smoked fish, which is more flavorful. 

Gifty plans to use the loan to purchase cartons of smoked fish in bulk from wholesalers to increase her business. She has been in business for 18 years and hopes to expand her business to meet her customers’ demands. One of her dreams is to own a shed in the community market and to see her children reach higher levels of education. 

Gifty is the leader of a trust bank group called “Asomdwie odzi mu,” which means perfect peace. There are seven members in this group who are traders. The group adopted a co-guarantee system to obtain the loan and uses peer pressure and assistance to one another to repay the loan. As the leader of the group, Gifty ensures that the group members attend meetings and make repayments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Loma Buenavista Group

texts.es:
El grupo de "Loma Buenavista" está integrado por seis integrantes son cuatro hombres y dos mujeres, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle así ya que el lugar donde viven está en la cima de un cerro y desde ahí se puede observa un bello panorama boscoso donde las heladas no han perjudico a los arboles el grupo ya existía anteriormente sin embargo los clientes anteriores cayeron en mora y tuvieron muchos problemas, así que ahora todos ellos son los nuevos integrantes del grupo, excepto Carlos S. que estaba desde el primer préstamo.
Don Juan quien ha quedado como representante del grupo tiene 39 años de casado, está casado con la señora Lorenza desde hace 27 años, juntos han procreado cuatro hijos, Eduardo quien tiene 12 años está estudiando la secundaria, Anayeli de nueve años cursa primaria, Wendy de 7 años está estudiando en S. año de secundaria y Juan el más pequeño esta en preescolar con 5 años de edad.
El señor Juan se dedica a la crianza de borregos para luego venderlos cuando estos ya están grandes, en la actividad lleva ya 28 años. en todo este tiempo no ha tenido ningún problema ya que los cuida muy bien y los lleva al veterinario si enferman.
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar dos borregos tenía en casa pero vendió y ahora volverá  a empezar otra vez, la esperanza que tiene don Juan es que sus animales crezcan y reproduzcan para poder incrementar su ganado y ganancias.
Los restantes del grupo también compraran borregos casi nadie compra alimento ya que aprovechan el pasto que hay en la comunidad para ahorrase lo del alimento, todas los días los sacan a pastar. Solo el señor Carlos quien comprara pollos también para criar para luego vender.
"Estamos muy agradecidos por la nueva oportunidad que nos ofrecen y estamos seguros que como grupo no quedaremos mal"
texts.en:
The group "Loma Buenavista" (Loma Beautiful View) is comprised of six members, four men and two women. The members of the group decided to name it that because the area where they live is at the top of a hill and from there you can see a beautiful wooded landscape where the frost does not harm the trees. The group has existed before but the clients were in arrears and had many problems. Today all of them are new members to the group, except for Carlos S. who’s been in the group since the first loan. 

Juan has been the representative of the group. He’s been married for 39 years, and he’s been married to Lorenza for 27 years. Together they have had four children, Eduardo who is 12 and in secondary school, Anayeli who is 9 and in primary school, Wendy who is 7 and in the second year of secondary school, and Juan who is the youngest at 5 years old and in preschool. 

Juan raises sheep and later sells them with they are grown. He has been in this business for 28 years. Now he doesn’t have any problem since he cares for them very well and he takes them to the veterinarian if they are sick. Now he has asked for a loan to buy two sheep he had at home but later sold, and now he will start again. Juan’s hope is that the animals he raises and breeds will be able to increase his stock and income. The others in the group will also buy sheep. Almost no one buys food since they take advantage of the pastures they have in the community in order to save on food. Each day they go to the pasture. Only Carlos will buy chickens, also for breeding and later resale. 

"We are very thankful for the new opportunity that they offer us and we are confident that as a group we will not lose face.”

loans.use: to buy two sheep

loans.name: Pay In Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Pay In” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 30 years old, married to a teacher, and has two children. Isatu sells slippers and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying dozens of slippers for resale.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers for resale.

loans.name: Heart

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Heart works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dealing beauty products. Heart is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other materials for the fishing business.

Heart has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing net and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo, age 53, is a responsible and diligent father who strives to ensure good crop production on his one-hectare plot of land, where he plants and harvest rice to sell. He has been cultivating it for over 20 years and earns about P30,000 each harvest season, which falls during the months of April and November. He also raises hogs for an additional income.

Eduardo and his wife have five children. Four have settled into marriage and one is pursuing a college education. 

Eduardo needs to improve his crop production to save enough money for the family's daily needs and for the sustenance of his hogs. Because he has insufficient funds, he is asking for a loan of PhP 30,000 to pay for land cultivation and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm.

In the future, Eduardo would like to improve his farming practices so that his farm can continuously yield good crops.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Hortencia cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando José Manuel está cursando 3º de bachiller, Isidro cursa 2º de bachiller y  rosa Isela cursa 2 de secundaria, su esposo se llama José Luis se dedica al campo. 

Ella  se dedica al comercio ya que es una señora muy trabajadora ella vende carne su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de puercos para la matanza ella espera que su préstamo le ayude ya que de su negocio le da para la los gastos de sus hijos, ya que le gustaría poner una carnicería para vender en su propia casa.

Hortensia pertenece al grupo “santa cruz” el cual esta integrado 14 personas todas son mujeres las cuales realizan una actividad comercial continuación serán mencionadas:
Carolina, Lucina, Adela, Leornanrda, Félix, Suleyma, maura, margarita, Guadalupe, Alicia, Lucila, todas tienen actividades comerciales como son: venta de comida, cosméticos, refrescos, abarrotes, pan, carnicería, comida, dulcería, etc.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school: José Manuel is in his 3rd year of high school, Isidro is in his 2nd year of high school, and Rosa Isela is in her 2nd year of middle school.  Hortencia’s husband is named José Luis and he makes a living in agriculture.

Hortencia is a very hard-working woman who makes a living selling meat.  She will invest her loan in purchasing pigs to butcher.  She hopes that the loan will help her, since her business pays for her children’s expenses.  She would like to set up a butcher’s shop in her house for selling meat.

Hortencia belongs to the “Santa Cruz” group, which is made up of 14 members.  All of the members are women who are engaged in commercial activities; the other members are Carolina, Lucina, Adela, Leonarda, Félix, Suleyma, Maura, Margarita, Guadalupe, Alicia, Lucila, Graciela, and Reyna.  They are involved in commercial activities such as selling meals, cosmetics, beverages, groceries, bread, meat, sweets, etc.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Guadalupe Isabel

texts.es: Guadalupe Isabel es una joven emprendedora, que no porque sea mujer está limitada a realizar trabajos que los hombres solo pueden hacer, hace poco inicio su negocio de lavado de automóviles donde ella también realiza esta actividad junto con su esposo donde lavan variedad de muebles como es camionetas, camiones, carros pequeños, taxi y mas a un precio accesible. El servicio que ofrece es lavar por fuera y aspirar por dentro dejando un aroma agradable para que le guste al cliente. En este momento necesita comprar una maquina de compresor de agua para poder lavar mejor el automóvil y ahorrar agua de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y ayudara al planeta.
texts.en: Guadalupe Isabel is a young enterprising woman who is not limited to doing “women’s work.”  A short time ago she started a car washing business where she and her husband wash various types of vehicles, such as  vans, trucks, small cars, and taxis at affordable prices.  The service includes an exterior wash, vacuuming, and applying air freshener so that the customer will like it.  At this time she needs to buy a pressure washer to be able to better wash the cars and save water.  In this way she can increase her income and help protect the planet.

loans.use: to buy a pressure washer.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 40 years old and engaged in the farming business. He was blessed with three children who are currently in school. He needs to work hard in his business to yield a better income for their studies.

Due to financial constraints, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his farming business. He hopes that this loan will help him develop his business in order to save for the future of his children, as well as improve their poor living standards.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his farming business

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gadi, a married father of a three-year-old, has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production. With profits from his enterprise, in the future Gadi wishes to acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina, aged 44, is an energetic woman involved in sewing and a boutique business. She is a very talented woman. She sews and designs dresses and displays them in her boutique. After seeing her dresses, many customers are attracted to buy from her. She does this work to supplement her family's income. In addition, she is also a very good mother who takes care of her three children. Her daughter is the eldest and she is studying in the 13th standard while her other two children are studying in the 10th standard. 

Rozina’s aspiration is to grow her business to a larger scale so she can transform her family’s living standard from good to better and generate more revenue. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan, she will purchase cloth, beads, and thread in larger quantities to be able to make new designs of clothes for selling and generating more revenue.

loans.use: to buy cloth, beads, and thread for a sewing business and boutique.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: For the past year Idah, a single woman who describes herself as ambitious, has been operating a retail store located in a busy area where she sells music disks and tapes. Idah, who describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold, will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more compact discs and tapes. Her business goal is to run a studio within five years.

loans.use: to buy more compact discs and tapes.

loans.name: Minonkpoé

texts.fr: Madame Minonkpoé vit avec son conjoint et leurs 02 enfants de 15 et 12ans à Lomé.  Elle revend du glaçon à domicile et son second crédit lui permettra d’acheter un congélateur et rénover son four à glace. A l’avenir, Minonkpoé  espère créer  d’autres fours à glace et bien entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Madame Minonkpoé lives in Lome with her spouse and their two children, who are 15 and 20. She resells ice cubes at home, and her second loan will allow her to buy a freezer and renovate her "four à glace." In the future, Minonkpoé hopes to create other "fours à glace" and take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and renovate a "four à glace"

loans.name: Longuino

texts.en:
Mr. Longuino S. is a Carpenter. He has a lot of experience in the field and has 6 years working in his workshop. When he started his workshop, he didn't have any tools, but he ran the workshop very well.

At the present time, he would like to buy more tools to work faster, and so he plans to buy an air compressor and a circular saw. These tools will give him the opportunity to make more wood furniture and sell it.

Mr. Longuino sells in local markets on the streets and in flea markets. Those are his natural markets and he is very successful selling there. For this reason, Mr Longuino is asking for a loan of $850,00 Dlls, and is committed to paying back the loan in a period of 6 to 12 months. With this money, he will buy the tools he needs and additional wood material. This will give him the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

ESPANOL

El Sr. Longuino S. es Carpintero, instaló su taller de carpintería hace 6 años cuenta con mucha experiencia en el ramo, cuando abrio su taller, lo hizo con la unica herramienta con la que el contaba en ese momento y ha funcionado bien pero se ha percatado de que el negocio marcharia mejor,si tuviera mejor herramienta por lo cual quiere comprar una sierra de banco y una compresora para pintar los muebles, de esta manera trabajaria mas rapido y con mejor calidad, esto tambien le daria la oportunidad de fabricar una mayor cantidad de muebles domesticos los cuales vende sobre ´pedido y en los mercados conocidos como pulgas. Por ello el Sr.Longuino solicita un crédito de $850.00 Dlls, pagaderos en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses con el cual planea comprar herramienta, que consiste en una sierra de banco y una compresora, con este equipo planea incrementar su venta y fabricación, de esta manera el podra dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use:
power tools, air compressor and circular saw,
wood material

loans.name: Omeka

texts.en: Omeka is 58, married, and has more than ten years' experience in sewing. Her business caters to locals, mostly people from her village. Her business is successful because people believe that it is cheaper to buy tailored clothes than ready-made ones. Her experience has gained her many customers some of whom come from overseas to buy her tailored clothes and designs.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing tools

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is 24 years old and lives with 3 members of her family in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to support her husband and needs a loan from AFSG. Her husband is a tailer and needs money to buy new machines and materials and to expand to a larger shop. He wants to help his family start a new life. They are very happy AFSG has supported him…….*** Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is for a female entrepreneur. ****

loans.use: Buy new machines for a tailor shop.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In I. is 36 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband and family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing yams, raising pigs and typically makes around $5 each day. Her husband works in a small private company and earns a small salary which contributes to the household expenses.

In order to generate additional income from the farm, In I. (pictured here in a yellow tee-shirt) is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of land and additional seeds, farm tools and fertilizer to make her land more productive. In the future, she hopes to earn enough to open an industry producing yam powder, which is popular with the people in her area.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land, seeds, fertilizer, and some farm tools to invest in her plantation.

loans.name: Shakhanim

texts.en: Shakhanim is 27 years old, married, and has a child. She lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her vine-growing. This young mother of one child has 4 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret E. is 33 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Benin. She owns a little shop in Ugbihoko, and she also sells garri. Recently her little shop has gained more popularity and the number of customers has increased. Margaret now wants to buy hair cream, weavons, and more garri for sale. She is therefore in need of a loan of US$ 175 to purchase these goods. Margaret has 5 years' experience in her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, weavons, and garri for sale in her little shop

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en: Kiki is 21 years old and married. She has been selling snacks since joining MBK. She usually earns $5 per day. Her husband D. is a worker, who earns $20 per week. She requests a $125 loan to buy more goods to sell. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
In Jirón Libertad, the city of Juliaca, we find Marcial,18 years old, and his dear mother, Victoria, eagerly selling their tools. This work has allowed him to try to get ahead and to offer well-being and security to his dear brothers. Since his father left him and abandoned the home, he, as the oldest son, together with his mother, assumed the responsibility of watching over the well-being of his younger brothers.

His perseverance and strength with his work has permitted him to excel and compete with other business owners who also sell similar items. This young man has a desire to rent a stand to sell a wide variety of merchandise, including construction materials. In order that his plans can take shape, he has asked for a loan - money that he is obliged to pay back in a term of 6 months. Marcial is very thankful for the opportunity that you are offering him to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

En el Jirón Libertad la ciudad de Juliaca, encontramos a Marcial de 18 años y a su querida madre, Victoria, ofreciendo afanosamente sus herramientas, oficio con el que trata de salir adelante y busca ofrecer bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hermanos.Desde que su padre lo dejó y abandonó su hogar, él como hijo mayor junto a su madre asumió la responsabilidad de velar por el bienestar de sus dos hermanos menores; su constancia y esfuerzo con el que realiza este oficio le está permitiendo sobresalir y competir con otros negociantes del mismo rubro.El deseo que tiene este joven muchacho es alquilar un local y ofrecer gran variedad de mercadería, adicionalmente desea vender material de construcción y para concretar sus planes hace la solicitud de un préstamo, dinero que se compromete a reembolsar en un lapso de seis meses.Marcial agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para acrecentar su negocio.

loans.use: To rent a stand/location to sell construction materials.

loans.name: 7 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
The "Seventh of March" Organization is a seven-year-old association within the Focal Center of Villa Adela, one of the most responsible and punctual groups with respect to paying bills and the prosperity of their businesses.

It is comprised in large part of older women, who definitely collaborate in aspects of responsibility and punctuality with the younger women who make up the Organization.

This association is characterized by the sales of merchandise, typically highly needed items, such as household supplies, and in some cases, the women are owners of grocery stores, or simply sell provisions on credit. The majority do not run their own businesses, but this does not impede their ability to work at fairs or markets.

Currently, the Seventh of March Organization needs cash to strengthen their business, preparing themselves for the Carnaval and Alasitas parties that are coming up.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Asociación 7 de Marzo, es una asociación con una antigüedad de más de 7 años dentro del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, una de las más responsables y puntuales en referencia al pago de cuotas y a la prosperidad de sus negocios.

Esta conformada en gran parte por mujeres de edad, quienes definitivamente colaboran en aspectos de responsabilidad y puntualidad principalmente a aquellas socias jóvenes que integran la Asociación.

Esta asociación se caracteriza por el comercio de mercadería, principalmente artículos de primera necesidad, como ser víveres y en algunos casos las señoras son dueñas de tiendas de abarrotes, o simplemente venta de víveres al crédito. La mayoría no cuenta con puestos de venta propio, pero eso no impide que realicen su trabajo en ferias y mercados.

Actualmente la asociación 7 de Marzo precisa de capital para fortalecer sus negocios, preparándolos para las fiestas de carnaval y alasitas que ya se aproxima.

loans.use: Strengthen businesses in preparation for upcoming holidays

loans.name: Beltha

texts.en:
Beltha E. was born in 1959; she is a widow and a mother of 5 children. Things became very difficult for her when her husband died. She depended on her husband because her parents died when she was still very young. She was forced into marriage immediately after the death of her father. She is not educated and she depended greatly on her husband’s daily income until his death. With all of these difficulties and too much sickness on her part, she was convinced to join GHAPE in 1999 by a very good friend.

She took out loans of $30 in 1999, $100 in 2000, $100 in 2001, and $200 in 2002. She invested the loans in farming of yams and cassava. Her achievements are countless, she pays schools fees to her children, spent some to learn a trade, and lastly she repaired her house.

Given a loan, she plans to continue her farm work, and believes that her business will be successful because she has experience in farming of yam and cassava. With the profits, she intends to educate her children, save some money, and provide food for her family.

loans.use: Farming of yams and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more stock for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with 4 children, ages 10-20 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children, ages 10-20 years old. Mwanamkuu sells clothes. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 3am to 19pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia sells chicken in her neighborhood’s market, she has done this for 11 years. She started selling spices, vegetables and groceries, but after seeing the profitability of the business, she decided to sell chicken. Every day, she sells in her store since very early until noon. Basilia has asked for loans to be able to pay for the construction of her house. In addition, she has also helped her husband with the maintenance of the taxi he drives. Later on, Basilia would like to start a store in her house, when she is finished building and furnishing it.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Basilia tiene una avícola en el mercado de su barrio desde hace 11 años. Ella inicialmente vendía espesería, verduras y abarrotes. Pero, luego de ver la rentabilidad del negocio, se decidió por la venta de pollos. Todos los días, ella vende en su avícola desde muy temprano hasta el mediodía. Basilia ha pedido préstamos para poder costear la construcción de su casa. Asimismo, también ha ayudado a su esposo con el mantenimiento mecánico del taxi que él maneja. Más adelante, a Basilia le gustaría poner una tienda en su misma casa, y terminar de construir y lucir su casa.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Yoeun P., 34, is a farmer in Prey Veng province. She is married with four children; two of whom are employed as garment factory workers, the others are students. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning around two dollars each day. She also makes two dollars each day. The couple would like a loan of $300 to purchase a grinding mill. (Mrs. Yoeun is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas N. was born in the year 1936. He is married with five children. His family has always faced the problem of serious illness, resulting in death due to lack of money to pay for medication. He also had an accident which rendered him helpless to his family for a long period of time. He finds it difficult to push forward in life after his recovery from the accident.

He was motivated by the above circumstances to become a member of GHAPE. He has successfully received and managed two loans totaling $160. The profit from these loans was used to pay school fees for his children, to pay hospital bills and to provide furniture for the home. Nicholas is requesting a new loan to invest in pigs, poultry, and farm crops like yams, cassava, and beans. He believes he will succeed because he has enough land to farm, enough experience, and enough time to work on his farm. His wife and children are going to help him work the farm. The profit from this loan will be used to add the farm land and to continue to provide for the family.

Nicholas plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and poultry

loans.name: Karla Marilet

texts.es:
F. H. , 34 years old, is married and has two sons.  One is 16 and is in his third year of high school; the other is 18 and in his fifth year of high school.  Her husband works as a security guard.  F. has a small seamstress shop and, like many people, she wants to get ahead and provide for her family.  Since her husband’s earnings do not cover all expenses and because her skill as a seamstress is her mother’s legacy to her, she wants to maintain her workshop as her principal activity.  F. began her business with a simple little treadle sewing machine.  She has always dreamed of expanding her workshop and improving its condition and equipment so that eventually she can create employment opportunities for others.
