With financial support through the Leon 2000 Foundation, she will be able to acquire the necessary equipment for her business.  Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

la señora F. H., tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos uno tiene 16 años actualemnte cursa el tercer años de secundaria y el otro tiene 18 años de edad cursa el quinto año de bachillerato, su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad, la actividad economica de la señora es un pequeño taller de costura que como toda persona deseosa de salir adelante y de aportar al nucleo familiar ya que el ingreso de su esposo no cubre en su totalidad, teniendo como base pricipal la experiencia que tenia en la actividad ya que es una herencia de su mama . La señora da inicio en esta actividad con una pequeña maquina sencilla de pedal, siempre a tenido el sueño de crecer y montar un taller con condiciones y tecnificado a fin de ser genradpra de empleo, a priori tiene la necesidad de acondiconar un locla apropieado para su taller y mas adelante adquirir con el apoyo de finanieras como leon 2000, mas equipos o activos para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Худойдодова Шарофат родилась 1967 года, разведенная. С 1996 года она  занимается предпринимательской деятельности. В оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует  женскими одеждами. Ее ассортимент состоит из женских национальных штанов с различными вышивками и тесьмою ручной работы, которые она сама шьет дома. А также отрезы с готовой набивкой для национальных платьев со штанами производства Коканд.  Закупает она товар у оптовых поставщиков в том же рынке.  
С помощью программы Кива Шарофат хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для увеличения ассортиментов.
texts.en:
Sharofat H. was born in 1967, she is divorced. Since 1996 she has been running her own business. She is selling women's clothing on the wholesale market Kovron in Dushanbe. Her assortment consists of women's national pants with different types of hand-made embroidery and stitching, which she makes herself. She also sells ready-made fabric cuts for national dresses and pants made by Kockand. She buys the merchandise from wholesalers on the same market. With the help of Kiva, Sharofat wants to get a loan for 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD) to increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy national clothing (pants)

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona tiene 41 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y madre de 03 hijos. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Simona es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” en Acari. Con su crédito inicial de S/.300 compró un quintal de ají. A los 18 años de edad tuvo su pareja y a los 20 años empezó el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ají, el cual trae del departamento de Tacna para ser comercializados los días viernes tanto al por mayor como al por menor en la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelamente continua con el engorde de ganado vacuno.

Con este crédito de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar con S/.500.00 cada quintal 04 quintales de ají de primera calidad l y 03 sacos de orégano a S/. 300 cada saco.

Su sueño es tener un establo grande y seguir con el engorde de ganado vacuno mejorado y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Simona is 41 years old, an elementary school graduate, married, and a mother of 3 children. She lives in downtown Acari, District and Province of Yunguyo, Puno. Simona is one of the founding members of the community bank “The Winners” in Acari. With an initial loan of S/.300, she bought 46 kg of chili peppers. At 18 years old, she got married and at 20 years old, she started her business of buying and selling cattle livestock. For the past 10 years, she has sold chili peppers that she brings to the Tacna department that are sold wholesale on Fridays and retail in the city of Desaguadero. At the same time, she continues to raise cattle livestock. With this loan of S/.3,000, to be paid in 3 payments, she has budgeted to purchase four 46 kg packs of high quality chili peppers at S/.500 per pack, and 3 sacks of oregano at S/.300 per sack. Her dream is to have a big stable and to continue raising her cattle livestock in order to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy high quality chili peppers and sacks of oregano

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
I. Sheriff is 34 years old and married with 4 children.  She sells drinks in crates.  She is happy because the demand for her drinks will be high during the festive season.  She hopes to increase the stock in her shop during this season.  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fresia Mercedes

texts.es: La Sr. Fresia tiene 34 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua , casada su esposo se desempeña como mecánico y tiene tres lindos hijos de 1, 9 y 12 años de edad dos lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Doña Fresia trabaja como cajera en una empresa privada desde hace ocho años de experiencia, su plan para su familia es brindarle un mejor nivel de vida  en el ámbito laboral, tener un trabajo  que le genere mayor ingreso y mejorar su casa que actualmente es de madera y zinc  a corto plazo desea construir su casa. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, bloques,  Para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y tener seguridad para su familia ya que la delincuencia anda día a día haciendo daño, lo cual es de su preocupación y desea terminar pronto de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fresia is 34 years old, is a resident of the Villa Reconcilación neighborhood in the capital of Managua, and is married. Her husband works as a mechanic and they have three lovely children aged 1, 9 and 12 years, two of which are studying in a school in the capital. Fresia works as a cashier in a private company, and her plan for her family is to provide them with a better standard of living in the working world, and for them to have a job that earns a higher income. In the short term, her plan is to improve and construct her house which currently is made of wood and metal. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, and blocks. Improving the infrastructure of her house will provide security for her family since she worries about the crime that is ongoing every day, and she would like to complete the improvements to her home soon.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Masele

texts.en: Masele T., 51, is married with seven children. She has 6 months of experience farming vegetables. Masele and her husband grow cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes, which they sell to people in the village three days a week. Masele is a new member of SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala (~$25USD). SPBD loans are Masele’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She would like a loan of $275 to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy equipment to maintain and improve her vegetable farm

loans.name: Yusmery

texts.es:
La señora Yusmery es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” de la Provincia Juli, Departamento de Puno; de  25 años de edad, es conviviente, con un solo hijos, posee estudio superior incompleta (trabajo social).
Trabaja desde hace tres años y seis meses, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la artesanía; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales para su  artesanía como lana (lana sintética, bayetas y otros).
Ella piensa mejorar su negocio de artesanía, ella desea tener una tienda de ropas para bebes, con este préstamo de  S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles para comprar más materiales para su artesanía(lana sintética  de distintos colores y bayetas, napa, lentejuelas, telas y otros), todo ello lo hace para obtener mas ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y asimismo desea terminar su estudio superior, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en seis cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yusmery is a member of "La Juleñita" Communal Bank located in the province of Juli in the state of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a common-law husband, one child and an incomplete education (she has completed some courses in social work). She has worked for three years and six months with the Manuela Ramos Movement and maks handicrafts. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase materials for her handicrafts like wool (synthetic wool, flannel cloth and others). She wants to improve her handicraft business and her desire is to have a store where she can sell clothing for babies. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she will purchase materials for her handicrafts (synthetic wool in different colors, flannel cloth, leather, sequins, fabrics and others). She does all of this to have a better income and to improve the quality of life of her family. She would also like to complete her studies. She promises to repay the loan on time in six monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en: Annet N. is a hard-working single mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of managing her retail shop that she has owned for six years so far. As a result, she has been able to buy a plot of land for her children, attend to their medical bills, clothe them, as well as feed them single-handedly. Annet is not certain whether she would have managed without the help of loans and has no hope of giving up on borrowing. She now needs another loan to help with restocking her shop with more products for making more profits.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: S. Saodat first applied to the MicroInvest loan program in 2007. It was a difficult period for her. She was dealing with troublesome competition and financial difficulties, and she could not even pay rent on the trade outlet. Saodat took a business development loan and realized quickly that she could import a new assortment of goods. She went to China and arranged to import seasonal women's wear. Since then she is working with Chinese suppliers. Saodat sells women's wear and she has a good variety. Now she is requesting another business development loan in the amount of $1100 for 12 months in order to import the new seasonal garments from the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She thanks KIVA for its support and hopes for all the best in the future.

loans.use: new seasonal women's wear imports from Kyrgyzstan Republic

loans.name: Isabel Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad.
Haydee es soltera, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Haydee es natural de la ciudad de Arequipa y vive 15 años en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Haydee vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Haydee vende calzados a pedido que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos de vestir.
Los sueños de Haydee son compra una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y trabajar en una institución de Salud.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the "Generosidad" community bank. Haydee is single; she is 42 years old and has four children. Haydee was born in Arequipa and lived 15 years in the city of Ayacucho. Haydee sells cosmetics from catalogues, which she offers to her friends and relatives. Haydee also sells shoes by special order as she acquires them from Lima. Haydee needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy dress shoes. Haydee dreams of buying a house in the city of Ayacucho and of working in an institute of health.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dress shoes

loans.name: Lydia Mukiibi‘S Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 20 years of age and married with one child aged three years. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with two people and takes care of her parents. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Lydia works in Kalerwe Market and that is how she earns her living. She buys her produce from farmers and uses public transport to and from the villages. Lydia sells to all categories of people and works seven days week. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, feeding the family, and school fees. She has been in this business for five years now. This is her first loan ever since she joined MCDT two weeks ago. Lydia wants to use this loan to buy more produce from villages She wants her business to grow and hopes to own her business' premises.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
LUCINDA L. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS LABORIOSAS” vive en la calle  caballo cocha Nº 127, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 25 años de edad, 2 hijos muy pequeños, y su pareja es mecánico.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes (venta por catálogos).  Cuenta con clientela fija.  El negocio ha mejorado por lo que necesita un mayor capital.

Con este préstamo  de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en la compra de media docena de perfumes, 1 paquete de  cosméticos y nuevos productos de belleza.

“Manuela Ramos me dio la oportunidad de poner mi propio negocio y me permite manejarlo sin descuidara mis pequeños hijos”.
texts.en:
Lucinda L. T. belongs to the Las Laboriosas (Hardworking Women) Communal Bank. She lives Caballo Cocha Street in the city of Pucallpa. Lucinda is 25 years old with two very small children. Her husband is a mechanic. With her first loan of 300 New Sols, she started her catalog sales business selling beauty products and perfumes. She has regular customers and the business has grown, but what it needs is more working capital. With this loan of 1,500 New Sols, she will buy half a dozen perfumes and an assortment of cosmetics and new beauty products. She says, "Manuela Ramos gave me the opportunity to set up my own business and it allows me to manage it without neglecting my little children."

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, cosmetics and other merchandise.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. is married and has 4 dependents. She did not receive a formal education. Nana is a fish monger and sells smoked fish in Duakyenim, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a salt miner. Nana uses all her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees. Nana will use the loan to buy fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save and use the money to further the children's education.

In the picture is Nana preparing some fishes for processing.

loans.use: For fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Вохидова Обида 1965 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей.  Обида торгует на рынке  более 14 лет она торгует детской одеждой. Раньше торговала продуктами питанием. Кредит  получила на расширение летней одежды. Решив что может справиться с торговлей она также открыла точку  продажи одежды.  О временем полностью перешла на торговлю детской одежды.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Obida V. is married and has 3 children. She has been selling at a market over 14 years. She currently sells children’s clothing, but used to sell food products. Having decided that she could handle the sales well, Obida also opened a clothing store. With time, she completely transitioned to selling children’s clothing. Obida requested a loan in order to expand her assortment of children’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Doña Rosario vive  en la zona urbana contiguo al mercado municipal de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando su 10mo credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda en la Construccion de un pantriella necesita este prestamo para construir un pantri y asi brindarle mejor comodidad a su familia, trabaja como directora  en la casa de la mujer  desde hace 16 años, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora que ha ayudado a muchas mujeres campesinas y de la cuidad que vienen de diferentes comarca a dar a luz a sus bebes en la casa de la mujer,  Chayitoha hecho muchas gestiones por estas mujeres para darles alojamiento y comida y tambien se les imparten charlas de planificacion y como cuidar a sus bebes, ademas  es una mujer lider y ejemplo para todas la mujeresen Nueva Guinea, tambien se desempeña como consejal de la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea, profesa la religion evangelica, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia y siempre seguir apoyando  al que lo necesita.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in the city next to the Nueva Guinea municipal market. She is seeking her 10th loan to invest in improving her home by building a pantry, thereby providing greater comfort to her family. She has worked as a director for a women’s home for 16 years, and is an enterprising woman who has helped many rural and urban women that come from different regions to give birth to their baby in the women’s home. She has made many efforts on behalf of these women, providing lodging and food and also family planning and baby care seminars. In addition to being a leader and role model for all the women in Nueva Guinea, she also works as a town councilor in Nueva Guinea and is an evangelical Christian. Her dream is having a home with better living conditions, steady work to support her family, and always able to continue supporting those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza C. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 35 years old, is married to Eustaquio, and has two school-aged children. Riza owns and operates a jewelry shop and also a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been engaged in her businesses for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es casada y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, vive en anticrético en la zona Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de niños y de mujeres la cual la reparte en distintas zonas de la misma ciudad, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres  hijos.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y poder acceder a un puesto de venta propio.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Vilma is married and has 3 children of school age. She lives in a rent-free home in the Mercurio zone of the city of El Alto. She is dedicated to the purchase and resale of clothes for women and children, which she markets in the various zones of his city. This is her main source of income, which which she pays for the maintenance of her three children. The loan will be used to increase her merchandise of clothes and to be able to rent a stall of her own. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies her for the approval of the loan requested by the client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more women and childrens clothing for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 51 years old and married with nine children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun K. lives in Moeun Tom Rong Village in TaK. Province. She breeds poultry. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens and duck food. Her husband, Mr. Eam Chreb, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. Mrs. Kun K. is a 31 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children attend the local school, but the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and duck food

loans.name: Otilia De Jesús

texts.es: Otilia De Jesús U. reside en ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador, tiene 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos José de 19 años y Edwin de 4 años de edad. Otilia posee su propio negocio donde vende tortas, el negocio se ubicado en un centro comercial donde hay mucha afluencia de personas y tiene a su favor una clientela muy estable, ya que son trece años de experiencia en su venta de tortas, el crédito que solita es para compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para tortas

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
S. Ibrogim is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of four adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ibrogim comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Gabriel Mambo

texts.en:
Gabriel is 52 years old and is married to Elizabeth. They are blessed with five daughters and one son.

Gabriel was introduced to Kiva partner KADET through an existing client. He is applying for his first loan with KADET. 

Gabriel has been operating a transport business as a taxi driver for the past two years. He wants to use this loan to purchase a car for his business. He also earns extra income from his rental houses.

Gabriel’s hope and dream is to purchase more cars for renting. He describes himself as an ambitious and a visionary businessman.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a car for his taxi business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Mayor's Village Lapasan Clarin Mis. Occ. She is 49 years old. Merlyn is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a store selling cosmetics products like lotion, shampoo, lipstick, and other products to the local community. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos y lleva 05 años en el negocio, ubicada al frente de la Plaza, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

Emma, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Emma belongs to the "Shatojinas Laboriosas" community bank in the Shatoja District in the province of El Dorado in the city of San Martin. She is married, is 48 years old and is a mother of 6 children, 3 of which still depend on her. Having always been known as a fighting spirit and the desire to get ahead by her own means, she started her own business selling anticuchos (grilled meat skewers and kebabs). She has been in the business for 5 years, that which is located in front of the Plaza. It is a good environment where there is much movement and gradually is becoming well known among her customers. Today she tells us that she's doing very well in this business. Today, she continues with the same business and is very pleased with her work. With this loan, she will buy inputs such as bagged rice, eggs, chickens and kitchen utensils to provide better quality service and replace the old utensils. Emma is very calm and content with what she does. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, eggs, chickens and utensils for her stall

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. Two kids are currently in school and the others have yet to learn a trade. She trades in yams in the local market in the community where she lives. Her major difficulty is having enough money to support her business. She could not send three of her children to school, so she wants to make money from the business to help them gain vocational training. She requests a loan to buy tubers of yams in bulk to grow her business and boost sales. Comfort would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Buy increased stock of yams.

loans.name: Yolanda Group

texts.es:
Grupo Yolanda está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes desean que el próximo año sus negocios prosperen y tener salud para seguir trabajando. Juliana L. es la coordinadora del grupo y según ella los préstamos le han ayudado mucho para surtir los pedidos de cosméticos que tenia. 

Esta señora de 32 años que distribuye productos de las marcar Avon, Zermat y Aravela el próximo año desea con sus ganancias si Dios se permite mejorar su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.

Rosa Lisbett B. M. empezó haciendo manicure, pedicura, peinados y masajes a domicilio además  ofertaba ropa y zapatos. Hace tres meses ella inauguró su propio salón de belleza y al lado puso su tienda de ropa y zapatos.

Yamileth del Socorro L. E. de 37 años fabrica bolsos de macramé, un arte que consiste en tejidos de nudos a mano ya sea de mecate, manila, hilos y plástico.
texts.en:
The Grupo Yolanda is comprised of three working women who hope that in the coming year their businesses will prosper and that they will be healthy enough to continue working. Juliana L. is the group's coordinator, and she says that the loans have been a great help in filling the orders for cosmetics that she has. This 32-year-old woman sells Avon, Zermat, and Aravela products. She hopes that next year, God willing, she will be able to renovate her home, which is in bad shape at the moment. Rosa Lisbett B. M. has begun doing in-home manicures, pedicures, hairstyles, and massages. She also sells clothing and shoes. Three years ago, she opened her own beauty salon with a clothing and shoe store next door. Yamileth del Socorro L. E., 37 years old, makes macrame bags, an art that consists of hand-tying knots out of either rope, hemp fiber, wire, or plastic.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami C. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PETIT KANDE depuis le 23 janvier 2007 et y a bénéficié de 06 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle est vendeuse de légumes: carottes, choux, tomates, aubergines, patates etc... au marché de son quartier. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ami C. is a 42-year old woman who is married with eight children. She has been a member of the village bank in PETIT KANDE since 23rd January 2007 and has had six loans, which she has managed well and repaid. She sells vegetables: carrots, cabbages, tomatoes, aubergines, potatoes etc.. at the market in her neighborhood. Her aim is to support her husband in taking care of the family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Mr. Vith U. is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and four children, who all attend local public school, in Sam Raong village in Takeo province.  Mr. Vith U. is a farmer.  He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  His wife, Mrs. Srey Mum (pictured at right), is a Khmer cheese seller.  They both support their family.

To improve their family's living conditions, Mr. Vith U. would like to start a new business breeding ducks.  He is seeking a loan from AMK to buy 120 ducks and rice to feed the ducks.

loans.use: To buy ducks and rice

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en:
Leoncie is 42 years old, she is married, and she has one child 12 years old. Leoncie lives in the Ngoma, a region of Rwamagana situated in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. Here, Leoncie has a business sewing various models of clothes. She has been in this business for about twenty-five years and she starts sewing early in the morning hours until late in the evening.

Leoncie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business through adding more sewing machines. With these additional sewing machines, Leoncie hopes to sew different styles of clothes which in turn will attract more customers.

With this loan, Leoncie hopes to create more jobs for the people in her community and she also hopes to earn more profits than previously.

loans.use: To buy additional sewing machines and clothing items

loans.name: Ericka

texts.en:
Ericka is a 30-year-old mother of two who lives in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She seeks to improve her economic conditions by harnessing her skills in the design and construction of piñatas (papier-mâché containers containing candies and other goodies) and other party materials and through the sale of school supplies. The loan consultant who has been working with Ericka over the past few months describes her as a person with good principles who is seeking to improve her living conditions.

Ericka’s products are used when celebrating events such as marriages, birthdays and communions. Ericka believes that selling school supplies represents an opportunity for her to earn a higher level of income because she lives close to a school and, at the moment, no one else is offering such products for sale. 

Ericka has been working over the past ten years in the production and sale of party materials; she started her business with an initial investment of 20,000 colons (approximately 35 USD). She is applying for a loan because she would like to start selling products from her home, as a kind of bazaar. In addition to the party materials she already produces, she has the idea of selling school supplies. This loan will be used to make investments in school supplies and materials necessary to the creation of party materials such as piñatas and handmade invitations.

Ericka makes party materials and piñatas on a per order basis which allows her to customize her products to the needs of her clients. Some of her clients request piñatas in the shape of famous superheroes while others request piñatas resembling famous princesses. Ericka spends, on average, twenty-five hours a week producing and selling her products. Her flexible work schedule allows her to take care of her children and perform domestic duties and allocate the rest of her day to her business.

Ericka’s main obstacle is financial. This loan will provide much needed working capital to get her business off the ground. Additionally, she faces competition in her neighborhood for certain products that she offers. Her goal is to expand her business, secure more clients and earn enough money to finance the studies of her children. In the future she would like to own a store separate from her home where she could sell a variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase materials necessary for the creation of party products and to buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Kely Yohanna

texts.es:
Kely A. vive en el barrio Los Ángeles en el occidente de Barranquilla, con sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad y su esposo que trabaja en la arquidiócesis de esta misma ciudad. Kely tiene 27 años y vende tanto prendas de plata y de oro golfi como útiles escolares a crédito. Se dedicó a la venta de mercancía desde muy joven; ella inició vendiendo productos, desde cuando era adolescente a sus compañeras del colegio. Hubo momentos en que la familia sólo vivía de vender prendas, sin embargo, con eso pudieron comprar el pequeño lote que ahora habitan y que han construido gradualmente;  En su negocio tienen una vitrina donde exhibe variedades y adornos, pero su mayor clientela son los empleados, compañeros de su esposo y asistentes en una clínica donde le practican  terapias de recuperación  a su niña menor. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación, entidad a que fue recomendada por su hermano que también está vinculado a esta organización. Con el  crédito de $1.500.000 que actualmente solicita Kely va a  surtir su vitrina y comprar ropa de niños, bolsos, prendas de plata y oro golfi que tiene encargados, este es un  surtido   que tiene mucha salida en su mercado doméstico.
El barrio en que vive Kely se ha ido mejorando a lo largo de los años: inicialmente no tenía servicios pero gradualmente la comunidad se reunió para conseguirlos y ahora han rellenado las calles y han ido urbanizando los lotes para alcanzar el estado en que ahora se encuentra y lo hace más vivible. Su meta es invertir el dinero de sus utilidades en su casa para hacerle un buen mejoramiento.
texts.en:
Kely A. lives in the Los Angeles neighborhood of east Barranquilla with her two children, 7- and 3-years old, and her husband, who works for the city's archdiocese. Kely is 27-years old and makes a living selling costume jewelry. She has been an entrepreneur since she was a girl, selling first to her school friends when she was a teenager. At times, the family lived on her sales but she was ultimately able to buy the small lot where they now live and they have gradually developed it. She has a glass case for the business where she can display her products but her best customers are her husband's co-workers and the nurses and aides at a rehabilitation center where she takes her daughter for treatment. This is the first time that Kely has applied to the Fundacion for a loan. Her brother, who has links with the bank, recommended that she apply. She will use the $1,500,000 loan to stock her business. She will buy children's clothing, bags, costume jewelry, all products that her target customers are likely to buy. The neighborhood where Kely lives has improved over the years. It had few services before but the neighbors banded together to get them and now the streets are paved and the properties are being registered so that they can get services more easily in the future. Her ultimate goal is to invest her earnings in her house to make it more liveable.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
Madame Bineta G. est  veuve et mère en charge de 3 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de bracelets, Thiouraye (encens) en face de l’hôpital régional de Thiès depuis 20 ans. 
En fait elle sollicite un prêt urgent  de 30 000 FCFA pour poursuivrele réglement des frais médicaux de son enfant âgé de 13 ans. En effet ce dernier est victime d’un accident et s’est trouvé avec sa jambe fracturée
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta G. is widowed and has 3 children in her care. She has had a business selling bracelets and Thiouraye (incense) across from the regional hospital of Thiès for the past 20 years. She is requesting an emergency loan of 30,000 FCFA in order to be able to pay for of her 13 year old child's medical expenses. Essentially, her child was the victim on an accident and his leg has been broken.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her child's medical expenses

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth J. lives in the village of Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has six school-aged children. She makes a living by providing motorcycle services to people in her community. She has been in this business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, and has applied for a new one, also for 10,000 PHP, to buy supplies that she needs to run her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her company to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is made up mainly of farmers, fisherman and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 51 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Juana (45)  y sus 4 menores hijos, a los que desea brindar una mejor educación.Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Juan, una actividad necesaria para sobrevivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propias tierras, donde tiene sembrados papas, alverjas y ollucos, los cuales una vez cosechados, llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, ya lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos son  los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar sus cultivos.Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juan con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener buenos cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 51, is a very hard-working and responsible father. He lives in his own house with his 45 year old wife, Juana, and their four minor children. He wants to give his children a better education. The fields with Juan’s crops have always been a necessary activity in his life in order to survive. Since he was very small his parents always taught him how to work on the farm. That is why he decided to continue with this familial work. Now he has his own land where he has planted potatoes, peas, and “ollucos” (a root vegetable). He will take them to the market in the city when they are harvested. What he likes most about his work is planting. He knows that the family’s peace of mind is dependent upon this activity. He has been doing this activity for 40 years. He thinks that the most difficult part in taking care of the crops is the abrupt changes in weather. This greatly affects his productivity. Later, he wishes to keep working hard and improve his crops. This is Juan’s fourth loan with MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial in developing this activity. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank. Therefore, he is very respected. He will use the 3,000 PEN he has requested to buy pea seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to have good crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru: Назаров Сангин проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сангин имеет средне - специальное образование, "Продавец". Работает по профессии. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sangin N. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Sangin has a secondary-specialized education as a salesperson. He works in his field. Sangin has a store, where he sells food products. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from Iligan City. She is 55 years old, married, and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Graciela ella tiene 44 años de edad y La socia es casada con 5 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand en una esquina de la plaza de Urcos, la socia vende panes desde muy temprano hasta que se le acabe, Ella administra y trabaja en su propio negocio desde hace 21 años, todos en el pueblo la conocen y cuando pasan los carros con destino a otras ciudades, ella ofrece panes frescos a los viajeros, La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar un nuevo stand y para los estudios de sus hijos aún dependientes de ella.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "QORI ORCCO". She lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco state. Graciela is 44 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in the Urcos district. Her business is retail sales. She has a stand on a corner in the plaza in Urcos where she sells bread from very early until she runs out. She has managed and worked at her own business for 21 years. Everyone in the town knows her and when cars pass by traveling to other cities, she offers fresh bread to the travelers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new stand and for the education of her children who are still at home with her. Graciela values and is extremely thankful for the loan as this allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new stand and for her children's education

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
This is 48 year old Sumitra T.. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 24 and 18. In 2008, she established a business raising cows. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young dairy cow. In the future, Sumitra plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy young dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es: Juana Gregoria tiene 48 años de edad con tres hijos todos ya mayores. El negocio de Doña Juana consiste en brindar el servicio de molino para masa para tortillas, pinolillo, pozol. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues para ella han sido importantes.  Su negocio lo inicio su marido pero debido a ciertas circunstancias de la vida falleció siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante. el destino del crédito es para la compra de algunos repuestos y mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Juana Gregoria is 48 years old with three adult children. Doña Juana's business is offering milling services for corn masa (dough) to make tortillas, pinolillo and pozol (two traditional corn and cacao drinks). This is not the first time she has taken out a loan; the loans have been important to her. Her husband began the business, but owing to certain circumstances of his life he passed away. Juana has always been a determined woman who knows how to get ahead. The purpose of the loan is for purchase of some spare parts and for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts and maintenance for mill

loans.name: Tserensonom

texts.en:
Tserensonom S. is 44 years old and lives with his family in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His older daughter attends a university while his younger daughter studies at a secondary school. His wife was a salesperson and worked in a rented stall at the local market, but she has been unemployed for the last several years. 

Tserensonom operates a taxi service. He began driving a taxi in 2008 and has gained a lot of experience since then. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He dreams of providing his children with a good education as well as to operate his wife's trading business. 

Tserensonom is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT ($1500) loan in order to pay both of his children's tuition fees and accommodation fees.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia L. 41 is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice for a living. She started earning her livelihood two years ago and she hopes to have a sustainable business to help support her family. 

She would like to apply a loan of PhP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. In this way, she will be able to continue earning an income to cover the education of their son.

loans.use: farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en el sector La Pala del distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cerdos. Ella cria estos animales en algunos ambientes acondicionados en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donD. vive. Adicionalmente cuenta con un negocio D. venta D. cerveza y chicha para el cual ha acondicionado una pequeña mesa en la parte exterior D. su domcilio.

Martha desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza D. sus lechones, D. modo que se puedan desarrollar D. mejor modo, ya que se acerca le fecha en la que tienen que ser destetados. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Martha es una mujer bastante activa y que gusta mucho D. trabajar para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer D. confianza.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband in the La Pala sector of the TambogranD. district. It is a primarily agricultural region located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque.

She raises pigs for a living. She raises them in the rear section of her house and she sells them to the businessmen that visit the region where she lives. She also sells beer and chicha, a fermented maize drink. To accommodate her customers she has set up a small table in the exterior part of her home. 

Martha wishes to acquire balanced feed to raise her piglets in an efficient way and to help their development and prepare for the butchering season. To this end she requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

Martha is a very active woman and she very much enjoys her work and she supports her husband in meeting their responsibilities. Those that know Martha love her and consider her to be a trustworthy person.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem M., 50, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. and her husband are fish sellers, earning an income of 2 USD each per day. M. has to spend 70 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

M. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to improve her family farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. is not available.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elisabeth Koska

texts.es:
La señora Elisabeth es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, lleva 6 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
La señora Elisabeth se dedica a la venta de comida en horas de la tarde, para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, porque el sueldo de profesor no le alcanza para todos los gastos de su hogar. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200, comprará utensilios, una nueva parrilla, un saco de carbón, 25 kilos de arroz para los Juanes (comida típica)y azúcar para los refrescos, 6 litros de aceite, condimentos, 1 doc. de vasos y demás insumos que le hacen falta.
Elisabeth está muy contenta porque puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y por lo mismo agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que presta a las mujeres  que desean realizar un negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a member of the El Arenal Community Bandk in the Calleria district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for six years.
Mrs. Elizabeth sells prepared food in the afternoons in order to help her husband with their household expenses because a teacher does not earn enough to pay for all the household expenses. With this loan of 1200 soles, she will buy utensils, a new grill, a sack of coal, 25 kilos of rice to be used for a typical dish called Juanes, sugar for drinks, six liters of oil, condiments, one dozen glasses and other supplies that she needs.
Elizabeth is very happy that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support that they give to women who are starting a business.

loans.use: She will buy supplies.

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es: Reyner, de 28 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive con su madre, en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Esté joven y vital hombre, hace 8 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales productos constan de café y plátanos. En todo este tiempo dedicado al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, pudo conseguir muchas cosas como comprar su propio terreno, con el cual pudo invertir más capital para sus sembríos. Sin embargo lo que más le gusta a él, es comercializar su producción, pues piensa que ve cristalizado sus esfuerzos. En el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde la mayoría de los acopiadores lo conocen, mencionan, que es un agricultor bueno, pues lo reconocen por su calidad de grano de café. Por ello más adelante desea seguir mejorando la calidad de sus cultivos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece la confianza depositada en él, pues asegura que con el apoyo de su banco comunal, logrará sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 8 sacos de abono orgánico y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la limpieza de la maleza que creció en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Reyner is 28 years old.  He is a single and hard-working man who lives with his mother in his own home in the community of Sanchirio (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This young, dynamic man has been farming for 8 years.  His main crops are coffee and bananas.

Over the years, Reyner has cared for his land.  He has managed to achieve many things, including buying his own plot of land which meant he was able to invest more capital in his crops.  However, what he most likes doing is selling his crops because he then sees the results of all his hard work in front of him.  Most of the traders in the city's wholesale market know Reyner and they comment that he is a good farmer and they recognize the quality of his coffee beans.  In the future, he would like to continue improving the quality of his crops.

This is Reyner's first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the trust which has been placed in him.  He assures us that with the support of his community bank he will achieve his goals.  For this reason he is planning to invest his loan money in buying 8 sacks of organic fertilizer and, if there is enough money left, he will invest it in clearing out the weeds which have grown on his land.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of fertilizer and to clear out the weeds which have grown on his farm land

loans.name: Kiiza

texts.en: Kiiza is a thirty one year-old married male with five children and owns a house in Kasese. He has been dealing in produce for the last ten years. Business hardships he face include price fluctuations, poor seasons and pests. His vision is to be a chief supplier for institutions around the area plus to have a well educated family. Kiiza needs the loan to buy beans and maize for sale.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Benson Mutua

texts.en: Benson K. is 56 years old and married to Alice who contributes to the family income. They have two children. Benson has been running his retail shop for five years with an income of Kshs. 20,000 per month. This is his second loan from  KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He hopes to be a leading retailer and start a wholesale store and give his children a quality education and improve their living standards

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and tea.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a Palestinian National Authority employee and the father of two daughters (Sally, 6 years old; Jihan, 5 years old) and one son (Naem, 3 years old). Muhammad has been unable to pay his electricity bill for a long time because he didn't receive his salary due to the unstable situation in the Gaza Strip. Now that his paycheck is back to normal, Muhammad took a loan from FATEN to pay the bill.

loans.use: to pay off the electricity bill

loans.name: Sith

texts.en: Sith M., 25, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. is employed at the garment facotry, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed as a construction worker for an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 53 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of USD 450 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to improve the family farming

loans.name: Angel

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 a 16 ans,trois de ses enfants vont a l'école, pour palier aux difficultés de sa famille elle va entreprendre en 2000 une activité sur la vente de la layette comme des couches, brassières, pulls, biberons et tous ce dont les femmes enceintes ont besoin pour la naissance de leur nouveau nés.
Elle a eu a rembourser sans trop de difficultés et a eu des épargnes considérables. 
Avec ce second prêt elle tient a renforcer le stock de ses marchandises et compléter ce dont qui lui manque.
 Elle a des ventes de 20000 a 35000frs par jour,elle tient a aller plus  loin avec son activité et être une femme de renommée dans son business, a la longue elle veut aller a l'étranger et avec ses bénéfices amener ses enfants a faire des grandes études.
texts.en:
Angel A., age 40, is a merchant. She's married and the mother of four children, aged between 2 and 16. Three of her children attend school. In 2000, in order to overcome the difficulties faced by her family, she started a business selling layettes, diapers, brassieres, sweaters, feeding bottles, and everything pregnant women need for the birth of their child.

She was able to repay her first loan without problems, and managed to put away a large sum. With this second loan, she wants to bolster and complete her stock of supplies. Her daily sales amount to XOF 20'000 to 30'000, and she wants to progress with her business and become renowned in her field of activity. In the future, she would like to use her profits to go abroad and get her children to pursue advanced studies.

loans.use: To buy dozens of diapers, brassieres, sweaters, feeding bottles

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Lagag. She is 40 years old. Julieta is married and has three children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008 Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Arnulfo

texts.es:
Fredy Arnulfo G. Q. tiene 39 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Fredy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es salir adelante para dar lo mejor a sus hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte, jugar carnaval y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Fredy Arnulfo G. Q., 39, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS (Agricultural Workers Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which is part of Chillanes canton.  It has nine members who are cocoa bean, coffee and orange farmers.

Fredy grows cocoa beans, coffee and oranges.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to get ahead to provide his children with the best.

He enjoys sports, playing Carnival and spending time with the family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his cocoa been, coffee and orange crops.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 33 years old and is married to a soldier. They do not have children yet. Olive is a tailor; she makes different styles from fabrics and is requesting a loan to buy traditional fabrics and thread for her tailoring business. She has done this business for three years, and with the profits, she wants to renovate their home.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics to sew clothing with.

loans.name: Bertin Jonas

texts.fr:
Bertin est un client de HOPE CONGO, age de 39 ans et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 10 ans.
Il est dans la vente des sacs , sandales et chaussures hommes, dames et enfants.

Il a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts, ayant fait des remboursements sans défaut des paiements, il a des épargnes considérables.
Avec le troisième prêt , il va agrandir renforcer le stock de ses marchandises,des lots de sandales dames, hommes et enfants de différents modèles.
A l'avenir il veut ouvrir une grande boutique des sandales et chaussures en gros tout en continuant a épargner pour aussi construire a la longue une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Bertin is a client of HOPE CONGO. He is 39 years old and the father of two children, two and 10 years of age. He sells bags, sandals and shoes for men, women and children. He already obtained two loans in the past and repaid them without issues. He was able to put money away. After his third loan, he will reinforce his stock, purchasing lots of sandals in different designs for women, men and children. In the future he would like to have a wholesale shoes and sandals store, continuing to grow his savings in order to build a house for his children eventually.

loans.use: to purchase bags, sandals and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya.  He is married and has two children, aged 16 and 12. He is 49 years old and has been in farming for two years.  He produces and sells milk, bananas and beans to the local market.  He has one farmhand and relies solely on farming to provide for his family.

John has made a second loan request of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He believes the cow will improve his family income and standard of living. He also hopes to improve the quality as well as the number of his dairy cows.

John says the fluctuation of milk prices is a great challenge in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jinkie

texts.en: Jinkie is from the village of Catumbalon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old, married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jinkie owns and operates a business buying and selling health and medicinal products such as generic drugs like paracetamol and amoxicillin. Her husband is providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services. Jinkie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Jinkie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinkie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jinkie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of generic medicines. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jinkie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of generic medicines

loans.name: Jekadi V Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JEKADI V est un regroupement de sept femmes  qui sont toutes mariées et  qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants à KAPALA. Elles ont en moyenne 26 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles font essentiellement  la culture du pois de terre depuis plusieurs années mais elles n’avaient jamais bénéficié d’un prêt pour leurs activités champêtres. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
ASSETOU, compte utiliser son argent pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Sikasso et à des clients possédant des unités de transformation de jus de pois de terre qui ne cessent d’augmenter. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000 à 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille. 
NB : La nommée  AWA avait accouchée raison pour la quelle elle ne figure pas sur la photo.
texts.en:
The group called JEKADI V is made up of seven women who are all married and who live in big traditional extended families with their children in KAPALA. They are 26 years old on average and have at least four children. They have essentially grown Bambara peas (sugar peas) for several years but they have never received a loan for their agricultural endeavors. Wishing to make their farming profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. 
 
ASSETOU expects to use her loan money to buy one sack of urea and two sacks of cereal-complex fertilizer, using the rest of the loan to cover the cost of plowing and weeding. She buys her supplies at the big open-air market of Sikasso. 

At the end of the rainy season, the harvested crops are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the big Sikasso marketplace to a growing number of customers who have equipment to make sugar pea juice. 

ASSETOU expects to make an average profit of 55,000 to 60,000 F CFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to cover everyday family expenses. 

Note: The group member named AWA had just given birth and that is why she is not in the photo.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora fabrica maquinas quemadores de sellos, productos que comercializa en los departamentos de Cobija , Beni y Santa Cruz; su esposo es el encargado de venderlos. El crédito lo requiere para comprar material como ser: goma, laminas de metal, y sellador especial. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado  y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en: Teodora is married and has 3 children. She makes machines that burn seals, which are sold in the departments of Cobija, Beni and Santa Cruz. Her husband is in charge of the sales. The loan is needed to buy materials like rubber, sheets of metal and special sealant. She lives in her parents' house in the zone of San Jose de Yunguyo in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy rubber, sheets of metal and special sealants for her business making stamps.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has six children.

In 1991 Amer opened a  wholesale food market selling grains and wheat. He has more than three years experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2500 loan to pay the annual rent for his market. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of mangoes, tomatoes, dried fish and coconut .

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever tiene 29 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un sector llamado Balsal, en el distrito de Cuervo , en el departamento de Cajamarca, este sector es pequeño , pero con muchas ganas de superarse y donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ala ganadería.  

Ever se  dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización  de ganado vacuno hace  más de 03 años, tiempo que le a permitido adquirir experiencia en este rubro, Ever cria su ganado cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos tienen el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
 
Ever esta  solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra  de ganado pequeño con su respectivo alimento balanceado , así como también pastos naturales que ayuden al engorde  y desarrollo de sus animales , para que los pueda vender a un mejor precio.

Ever es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con mucho esfuerzo desea que su familia se supere y que su hijo tenga otras y mejores oportunidades, para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ever, 29, lives with his wife and small child.  He has his own house which is located in a neighborhood called Balsal, in the Cuervo district of the department of Cajamarca.  This neighborhood is small, but the residents have a desire to get ahead.  In this place, most of the people work in agriculture and livestock production.

Ever has had a business raising, fattening and selling dairy cows for more than 3 years, and over this time he has gained experience in this line of work.  Ever raises his cows near his house, and when they are at the ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.

Ever is requesting a loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy young cows and nutritionally balanced feed.  He will also buy natural pasture grass that will help him to fatten and develop his animals, so that he can sell them at a better price.

Ever is a hardworking and responsible person who, with a lot of effort, hopes to see his family get ahead.  He also hopes that his child will have other and better opportunities for his development.

loans.use: to buy young animals and animal feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 36-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has three children living in a semi-permanent house and her dream is to construct a permanent house for residence.
